High reliability and consistent attendance

If you are not comfortable with this, this role is not suitable, as all hours are tracked and paid through this system



Responsibilities

Responding promptly and professionally to client enquiries

Making cold and warm (hot) outbound calls to potential and existing clients

Sending
 outreach to both hot and cold leads

Identifying and researching key decision-makers within companies

Maintaining accurate records of calls, outreach, and communication

Working collaboratively with the sales team to achieve targets



Compensation & Structure

Hourly pay: USD $4.50–$5.00, paid based on tracked hours

Casual hourly structure

Full-time role with long-term stability

Clear opportunity for growth within an evolving international company



How to Apply

Please send the following

Your resume (CV)

A short voice recording introducing yourself

A brief written explanation of your background and relevant experience

Applications without a voice recording will not be considered.

title: WordPress Web Developer – Experienced Only
description:
WordPress Web Developer – Experienced Only



We’re looking for a highly skilled and self-sufficient WordPress Web Developer to join our team. This is a technical, hands-on role — not a "learn on the job" opportunity. We've had applicants in the past who underestimated the complexity involved, so let us be clear: you must have real-world experience and be confident handling WordPress development, automation, and integrations independently.



What You’ll Be Doing



-Website Management

-Maintain and update WordPress core, themes, and plugins.

-Add/modify website content, including product updates.

-Troubleshoot technical issues swiftly to minimize downtime.

-Optimize site performance across devices.



Automation & Tool Integrations



-Set up and manage workflow automation (e.g., using Make/Zapier).

-Integrate third-party tools such as Gravity Forms, Slack, Monday, Mailchimp, and HubSpot.

-Hosting & Migrations

-Handle full website migrations, including transitions to AWS or other cloud platforms.

-Set up and manage hosting environments to ensure reliability and speed.

-Security & SEO (Bonus)



Implement best practices for website security.



-Perform regular backups and vulnerability checks.

-Familiarity with SEO and tracking tools (Google Analytics, keyword tools) is a plus.

-Continuous Improvement

-Proactively propose and test new features or functionality.

-Maintain version control and staging practices before deploying changes.



What You Must Have



-Extensive WordPress development experience (this is not an entry-level role).

-Strong experience with automation tools such as Zappier

-Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP.

-Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills.

-Experience with AWS or other cloud hosting platforms.

-Familiarity with automation tools like Make, Gravity Forms, Mailchimp, etc.

-Ability to manage multiple priorities independently and efficiently.

-Excellent communication and collaboration skills.



Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)



-SEO and web analytics knowledge.

-Experience with e-commerce platforms and payment gateways.

-Familiarity with Slack, Monday, and similar project tools.



Working Structure & Expectations



This is a part-time role, paid hourly, and you will be required to track both your hours and productivity using a platform called Traq, with the possibility of doing full-time hours if you have the correct skill set.



Wages a paid monthly based on your TraQ schedule.





If this arrangement does not suit you, unfortunately, this may not be the right opportunity.



How to Apply



Please send:



Your resume



A cover letter outlining your relevant experience



Links to websites you’ve built or managed



Applications missing any of these three items will not be considered.



Also, let us know:



Your hourly/salary expectations.

title: Appointment Setting Assistant (Outbound)
description:
Appointment Setting Assistant (Outbound)



Starlight Marketing is looking for a reliable and confident Appointment Setting Assistant (Outbound) to support our outreach efforts by scheduling qualified calls for the team.



In this role, your main responsibility is to connect with potential prospects, introduce our services using a provided script, and book appointments for interested individuals. You will not be closing sales — your focus is on starting conversations and securing scheduled meetings.



What your day will look like:

? Making outbound calls to assigned leads

? Following a structured script to introduce our services

? Answering basic questions and handling simple objections

? Booking qualified prospects into the calendar

? Logging call outcomes accurately in the tracking system

? Meeting daily or weekly booking targets



Availability Requirement:

? Must not have any current full-time employment

? Must be fully available during assigned working hours

? No overlapping remote jobs while working with the company



Technical Requirements:

? Must have your own laptop or desktop computer

? Minimum 8GB RAM

? Stable internet connection with at least 30 Mbps speed



Experience in appointment setting, telemarketing, or outbound calling is a plus but not required. Training and scripts will be provided for the right candidate who is coachable and motivated.



This is a remote, long-term opportunity with stable hours and performance-based growth potential as Starlight Marketing continues to grow.



If you’re confident on the phone, fully available, and motivated by booking appointments and hitting targets, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Virtual Accountant / Bookkeeper – UK CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)
description:
Follow the application instructions below.



About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering the best value property maintenance has established us as a reliable partner for residential and commercial clients nationwide. With decades of experience, including 50 years of expertise in garage conversions, we pride ourselves on impeccable craftsmanship, turning our clients' visions into reality while ensuring their properties remain in top condition.



Role Overview



We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accounting Virtual Assistant to join our dynamic team. This role focuses on comprehensive financial management and accounting support, including UK-specific compliance requirements. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, managing accounts payable and receivable, ensuring regulatory compliance, and providing essential financial reporting to support our expanding operations across Ireland and the UK.



Key Responsibilities

Bookkeeping & Financial Data Management



Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for all business transactions

Data Entry: Process and record financial data with precision and attention to detail

Invoice Management: Handle invoicing processes and payment processing for clients and suppliers

Account Reconciliation: Reconcile bank statements and maintain accurate account balances

Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using accounting software including MYOB



Accounts Management



Accounts Payable: Manage supplier payments, vendor invoices, and payment scheduling

Accounts Receivable: Monitor client payments, follow up on outstanding invoices, and manage debt collection

Cash Flow Management: Track and report on cash flow positions and payment cycles

Credit Control: Implement credit control procedures and manage customer payment terms



UK Compliance & Regulatory Requirements



CIS Compliance: Manage Construction Industry Scheme (CIS) compliance and monthly reporting

VAT Returns: Prepare and submit VAT returns ensuring full compliance with HMRC requirements

Tax Compliance: Maintain compliance with all UK tax regulations and submission deadlines

HMRC Submissions: Handle various HMRC submissions and correspondence



Payroll & Employment Administration



Payroll Management: Process PAYE (Pay As You Earn) and CIS payroll for employees and subcontractors

Employment Records: Maintain accurate employment records and statutory documentation

Pension Administration: Support workplace pension scheme administration and compliance

Statutory Payments: Calculate and process statutory sick pay, maternity pay, and other employment-related payments



Financial Reporting & Analysis



P&L Preparation: Generate comprehensive Profit & Loss statements and financial reports

Financial Analysis: Provide financial analysis and insights to support business decision-making

Management Reporting: Prepare regular financial reports for management review

Budget Support: Assist with budget preparation and variance analysis



Tax Preparation & Professional Support



Tax Preparation: Prepare and organize documentation for annual tax returns and submissions

Professional Liaison: Work closely with external accountants and tax advisors

Audit Support: Provide documentation and support during audits and financial reviews

Compliance Monitoring: Ensure all financial practices meet regulatory standards



Required Skills & Experience

Essential Qualifications



UK Tax Knowledge: Strong understanding of UK tax system, VAT, CIS, and PAYE regulations

Construction Industry: Experience with construction industry accounting and CIS compliance preferred

Compliance Expertise: Knowledge of HMRC requirements and submission processes

Accounting Software: Proficiency in accounting software (Sage, Xero, QuickBooks, MYOB or similar platforms)



Instructions

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

title: Electrical Engineer / Quantity Surveyor - Remote
description:
About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering high-quality property maintenance and electrical solutions has made us a trusted partner for residential, commercial, and industrial clients nationwide. With decades of experience in electrical systems, installations, and maintenance, we take pride in our technical expertise and craftsmanship—ensuring our clients’ properties remain safe, efficient, and fully compliant with modern standards.



Role Overview



We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Electrical Engineer to join our team. This role involves electrical design, project coordination, system analysis, and technical documentation. The successful candidate will work closely with project managers, site teams, and clients to ensure accurate planning, safe installations, and seamless execution of all electrical works—from concept design to project completion.



Key Responsibilities

Electrical Engineering & Design



Electrical System Design: Develop, review, and interpret electrical plans, schematics, and load calculations.

Technical Specifications: Prepare detailed specifications, diagrams, SLDs (single-line diagrams), and layout drawings.

Material & Equipment Selection: Determine appropriate electrical components, materials, and equipment required for projects.

Compliance & Standards: Ensure designs meet electrical codes, safety standards, and regulatory requirements.



Project Coordination & Client Management



Site Coordination: Work with contractors, site engineers, and electricians to ensure proper installation and site execution.

Client Communication: Liaise with clients to clarify requirements, provide technical updates, and explain engineering decisions.

Documentation: Prepare project reports, progress updates, testing results, QA/QC records, and risk assessments.

Change Management: Document revisions to electrical plans and update load calculations, cost impacts, and schedules accordingly.



Testing, Maintenance & Quality Control



System Testing: Perform testing, commissioning, and troubleshooting of electrical systems and equipment.

Preventive Maintenance: Evaluate system performance and recommend maintenance schedules or upgrades.

Safety Compliance: Ensure all electrical work follows safety protocols, lock-out/tag-out procedures, and hazard assessments.



Financial Administration & Office Support



Cost Estimation: Prepare electrical cost estimates, material take-offs, and assist in budget planning.

Invoice & Documentation: Support invoicing, procurement coordination, and inventory updates for electrical materials.

Technical Records: Maintain accurate documentation, permits, and electrical certification records.



Required Skills & Experience

Technical Requirements



Electrical Engineering: Proven experience in electrical design, installation supervision, testing, and commissioning.

Codes & Standards: Strong understanding of local electrical codes, NEC/IEC standards, and safety regulations.

Technical Proficiency: Skilled in electrical drafting tools (AutoCAD, Revit MEP, or similar) and testing instruments.

Project Knowledge: Familiarity with construction processes, electrical layouts, and engineering documentation.

Professional Skills



Analytical Ability: Strong problem-solving and technical analysis skills.



Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication for client and contractor coordination.

Organization: Ability to handle multiple projects, documentation, and scheduling tasks efficiently.

Adaptability: Capable of managing both office-based work and technical project duties.



What We Offer



Competitive compensation package

Opportunities to work with clients across Ireland and the UK

Professional development and training programs

Collaborative and supportive remote work environment

Clear career advancement pathways

Exposure to diverse engineering and construction projects

Flexible remote working systems with comprehensive support



Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

Prepare accurate brickwork and blockwork quantity take-offs, including bricks, blocks, mortar, lintels, insulation, and related masonry components

Required Skills & Experience



Technical Requirements

Professional Skills



Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities with exceptional attention to detail

Software Proficiency: Competency in quantity surveying software, spreadsheet applications, and financial systems

Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for client and contractor liaison

Organization: Outstanding organizational skills with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

Adaptability: Flexibility to handle diverse administrative and technical tasks



What We Offer



Competitive salary package.

Opportunity to work with self-builders across Ireland and the UK.

Professional development and training opportunities.

Collaborative and supportive remote work environment.

Career growth potential within an expanding company.

Involvement in diverse construction and visualization projects.

Remote working flexibility with comprehensive project support systems.

Experience working on international projects with diverse clients.

title: AI Content Assistant for WordPress
description:
We manage 50+ multilingual online stores and are looking for a reliable AI Content Assistant to help us scale product content efficiently.

What you’ll be doing



- Generating product descriptions using ChatGPT based on ready-made prompts

title: Marketing Specialist – UK Mortgage Company
description:
Role: Marketing Specialist – UK Mortgage Company



Work Hours

9:00 AM – 6:00 PM (GMT)



Initial Qualifications

Valid Passport ID

Reliable high-speed internet



How to Apply:



When submitting your application, please take note of the following points:



Use 18 APP in your application.



Use the following subject line format:

Case Manager – FHH009



Attach your updated resume in PDF.



Provide a 3-minute video introduction link along with your application. (Google Drive, Loom, or unlisted YouTube). Ensure that access is unrestricted.



In the video, aside from introducing yourself and your brief work experience, kindly clearly answer the following questions:



Why would you make a good Marketing Specialist?



Share one marketing idea or campaign concept you would suggest for a UK mortgage company.



Tell us about a digital tool that would improve productivity in this role and why.



Where do you see yourself in three years’ time?



Why would you like to join this company?And finally, tell us a joke that will make us laugh



Job Overview



We are a UK-based mortgage company seeking a proactive and organised Marketing Specialist to support brand growth, client acquisition, and lead generation within the UK property and mortgage market.



Your main role is to help attract and nurture qualified mortgage leads through strategic campaigns, content creation, and marketing coordination. You will assist in promoting our services clearly and professionally to a UK-based audience while supporting business development initiatives.



You will work closely with the Director, brokers, and case managers to ensure marketing efforts align with company goals and contribute to consistent brand messaging and lead growth.



Key Responsibilities



Assist in developing and executing marketing campaigns targeted at UK mortgage clients



Create, schedule, and manage social media and educational mortgage content



Support lead generation initiatives for property buyers and refinancing clients



Maintain marketing calendars and promotional schedules

Required Skills & Experience



Strong written and spoken English suitable for UK audiences



Experience in marketing, digital marketing, or content coordination (preferred)



Understanding of financial services, real estate, or mortgage marketing (preferred)



Ability to present complex information in simple, client-friendly language



Highly organised with strong time-management skills



Able to work independently with minimal supervision



Creative problem-solving and proactive communication skills



Technical Requirements

Familiarity with
 marketing platforms

Laptop

Job Overview:



We are a UK-based mortgage company looking for a dependable and organised Case Manager to handle the day-to-day progress of our mortgage applications.



Your main role is to ensure each case moves smoothly—from submission to offer—by keeping everything updated, following up and communicating with clients, and making sure all required documents are complete.



You will work closely with the Director and help streamline the process by managing information, tracking deadlines, and ensuring no case is left behind.



Skills & Experience

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Very organised and detail-oriented

- Able to update and manage multiple cases daily

title: Bookkeeper - Airbnb Property Management
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Virtual Assistant to support our bookkeeping and accounts payable operations for NC Stays. 

This role is critical to keeping our financial records accurate, contractors paid on time, budgets monitored, and owner statements reliable. 

You will work closely with our internal team, including Guest Services, to ensure expenses are properly documented, categorized, and tracked.

This position is ideal for someone who is organized, proactive, and comfortable working in accounting systems with minimal supervision.



Key Responsibilities

Accounts Payable 

Fully own Accounts Payable, ensuring same-day payment processing Monday–Friday via Topkey or sometimes Venmo.

Track due dates and prioritize urgent or time-sensitive payments

Communicate clearly with internal team regarding payment status

Ensure bills are paid and categorized to correct property/owner so that owner statements are accurate 

Run monthly payroll via Gusto



Budget & Expense Tracking

Review budget vs. actuals for NC Stays on a regular basis

Identify variances, unusual spending, or inconsistencies and flag them for review

Expense Categorizing

Follow up with internal tea
mbers that didn’t input 

Identify variances, unusual spending, or inconsistencies and flag them for review



Track Onboarding expenses and revenue

Track onboarding expenses for new properties to ensure costs are complete, accurate, and properly categorized. And ensure they’re profitable at least by 10%.  

Invoicing clients 



Owner Statement Review

Review owner statements for accuracy and completeness

Identify and flag discrepancies, missing charges, or misclassifications

Collaborate with internal stakeholders to resolve issues before statements are finalized

Ensure statements are clean and have consistent nomenclature across all properties (For example - Supplies - Consumables. Or Supplies - New Trash Can. 



Transaction Categorization

Accurately categorize transactions. Including splitting transactions by property 

Ensure expenses and payments are coded consistently and correctly

Follow up with internal tea
mbers that didn’t input correct property or category on a daily basis

Maintain clean books by resolving uncategorized items promptly

Track reimbursements

Cross-Team Collaboration

Work closely with the Guest Services team to obtain context for charges, repairs, and supplies

Ask clarifying questions when needed to ensure accurate financial records

Maintain a collaborative, team-first mindset



Create Scorecard and Own Reporting on Data Points Below

Monthly

Net Operating Income %

Revenue Growth YoY and %

Payroll % of Income

Customer Acquisitions Costs

Life Time Value

EBITDA per Property

Gross Rents Per Property

Sales / Marketing Spend %

Software Spend %

Vendor 1099’s and W9 Collection

Own 1099 Process

Own 1099 Process and ensure all Vendors Contact information and W9 is up to date and accurate on a monthly basis in Quickbooks so that 1099 Season is a breeze. 

Reach out to vendors to collect information if not already given

Ad-Hoc reporting

Be able to work with business owner to run Ad-hoc reports 

Be forward thinking in using ChatGPT and other AI tools to analyze data quicker

Create custom GPT’s using ChatGPT based on data analyzed by ChatGPT



Occupancy Tax 

Pay out local jurisdictions in North Carolina occupancy tax. 





Required Skills & Qualifications

You MUST have a growth mindset and be willing to grow your skillset. 

Prior experience in bookkeeping, accounts payable, or accounting support

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Comfortable working with accounting software (QuickBooks or similar preferred)

Ability to manage recurring daily tasks and deadlines independently

Clear written communication and responsiveness during business hours

Strong organizational and time-management skills

Experience working as a Virtual Assistant or remote accounting support

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working as a Virtual Assistant or remote accounting support

Familiarity with property management, hospitality, or short-term rental businesses

Worked with VRPlatform

Worked with TopKey

Experience reviewing budgets, financial statements, or owner reports

What Success Looks Like

All invoices are processed and paid on time, every business day

Budget vs. actual variances are clearly tracked and communicated to business owner

Onboarding expenses are fully captured and easy to audit

Books remain clean with Zero uncategorized transactions on a weekly basis

Owner statements are accurate and require minimal corrections and completed by the 10th of each month

Strong communication and collaboration with the Guest Services team



Compensation

$850 USD per month w/ Annual performance bonus bonus

This is a structured, process-driven role within a premium environment.



About the Role



You will be making outbound calls to targeted contacts and turning cold outreach into qualified yacht charter inquiries.



Your responsibility is to:



Make outbound calls with a calm, premium tone



Spark interest and identify whether there is real charter intent



Collect essential high-level information



Keep calls short, controlled, and professional



Write clean, structured notes and prepare a clear handoff summary



Maintain strict organization during your shift





This role requires clarity, control, and discipline, not aggressive selling.



What We Expect



Excellent spoken English (clear, professional, premium tone)



Confidence on the phone and ability to handle rejection calmly



Ability to keep conversations short and controlled



Structured thinking and strong attention to detail



Fast execution and consistency during shift



Comfort following a defined process



Very stable internet and professional working setup (quiet environment + headset; dual screen recommended)



Previous experience in cold calling.



Compensation



$500 per month (to start)



Long-term opportunity with growth potential



Working Style



We value:



Speed



Clean communication



Reliability



Maturity



Process discipline



It’s a structured, premium, and execution-focused role.



How to Apply



Please send:



A short introduction about yourself



Your previous outbound/calling experience



Your internet speed



Your availability (hours per day and days per week)



A 30–60 sec voice note in English (your natural phone tone)



We review applications carefully and only contact shortlisted candidates.

title: Experienced Video/Photo Editor for Ecommerce (Facebook & Tiktok Ads)
description:
Hey there!



I am looking for a skilled, experienced video and photo editor who can create compelling ads that maximize video engagement and drive sales for our growing e-commerce business. In a nutshell,  I need a professional with actual working experience creating ads who can hit the ground running day 1. You need to be highly proficient with CapCut Pro (or Adobe Premiere Pro), able to recreate example video ads without step-by-step technical guidance, and skilled at sourcing relevant clips online. This position requires someone who pays close attention to detail and has proven experience in the field. Working, professional photo editing experince is not required, however, you should be very comfortable handle photo editing tasks without technical assistance. If terms like "keyframe motion" or "background removal" sound unfamiliar to you, this position isn't the right fit for you. Please don't be intimidated by the detailed requirements—if you're truly experienced, you'll easily recognize everything I'm looking for.



Essential Requirements:



- Professional Video Editing Experience: MINIMUM 1 full year working experience creating video advertisements. This is non-negotiable.



- Technical Proficiency: Expert-level skills in CapCut Pro (strongly preferred) or Adobe Premiere Pro. You must be able to navigate these programs without assistance.



- Social Media Expertise: Deep understanding of current social media trends, styles, and what makes content perform well on platforms like Tiktok,
, & Instagram.



- Content Sourcing Skills: Strong ability to find and source appropriate video clips from social media platforms to create & enhance ad content. ***very important



- Photo Editing Abilities: Proficient with Canva for creating and editing photos. While professional, working photo editing experience isn't required, you cannot be a beginner.



- Attention to Detail: Exceptional eye for detail and consistency. We need someone who catches small errors before submitting work.



- Communication: Fluent English with excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to clearly understand directions and express ideas. You must be easy to understand as well, cannot speak vaguely. 



*Bonus Skills:

- Experience with AI image generation tools like ChatGPT image generator and Midjourney is a PLUS+

- Experience with AI UGC generation like Arcads and HeyGen is a PLUS+



Daily Responsibilities

1. Video Ad Creation: Recreating successful ad formats with our products based on examples provided

2. Script Implementation: Working with provided scripts to create compelling video content

3. Content Sourcing: Finding appropriate supplementary video clips from social media and other sources

4. Revision Management: Implementing feedback and making requested changes efficiently

5. Photo Ad Creation: Designing static image ads using Canva based on examples and direction

6. Content Organization: Breaking down raw footage into usable segments and organizing media files



How Day-to-Day Will Look:

1. You'll receive an example ad and script to recreate for our product

2. You'll source appropriate clips using your expertise (sometimes we'll provide clips, MOST of the time you'll need to find them)

3. You'll create the ad, applying your technical knowledge to make it as similar as possible to the example ad. Must also understand and apply any direction given by me

4. We'll review your work and provide feedback for revisions

5. For photo ads, you'll receive example ads to recreate using our product images and provided text

6. You'll be responsible for organizing and categorizing raw footage as needed



Important Notes

- We will NOT provide technical training - you must already be proficient with video & photo editing

- Your portfolio is crucial - we need to see examples of your previous video ad work

- This position WILL lead to full-time employment, so you cannot be working for another company



Compensation & Career Path:



If hired, you'll start part-time for the first month (can be negotiable). Successful candidates will then transition to full-time. Salary is paid bi-weekly and will be based on your experience and skill level.



The growth potential in this role is substantial. As you naturally develop expertise in what ads perform best for our brand, at that point, you'll have the opportunity to lead a team of editors (if desired). From there, if you are able to instruct editors on how to create good ads, you will have an even better understanding of what kinds of ads perform the best. Then you can advance to a creative strategist position where you'll begin to earn a percentage of profits. Once you've mastered creative strategy for one brand, you can handle our other brands, earning a percentage of profit for each brand you are in charge of.



We build long-term e-commerce brands with year-over-year growth, not typical dropshipping stores. Within the past two years, we've had four notable hires here on OnlineJobs—three have become creative strategists managing advertising across our brands, with the lowest earner making $250,000 USD a year. Our longest-tenured editor is now developing their own e-commerce brand with our support, as I am writing this.



If you have the experience and skills described above, please apply! Message me with the subject line "JP1 EDITOR" and give me a brief summary about you and your experience editing video ads. DO NOT SEND AN
.



Here are just a few examples of ads I am expecting you to be able to recreate.

title: Instagram Outreach VA
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented, process-driven Instagram Outreach VA to help us license content from social media creators. This is a fully remote role, with full training provided. No prior experience required — we hire for attitude and train for skill.



---

About the Role



As a Instagram Outreach VA, you’ll be responsible for spotting viral, interesting, or newsworthy content on Instagram and other social platforms, reaching out to creators for permission, and organizing licensed content in Trello for our team. You’ll work closely with our existing tea
mbers and leverage tools like Claude Bot to make outreach and content licensing efficient.



This is a process-driven role, so attention to detail, reliability, and strong communication are essential.



---

Key Responsibilities



- Browse Instagram and other social media platforms to identify viral, newsworthy, or interesting content that matches our Ideal Customer Profile (ICP)

- Evaluate and select content worth licensing

- Send outreach messages (DMs) to creators using pre-written scripts and Claude Bot templates

- Handle creator responses and negotiations professionally

- Work toward securing permission to use content

---



Daily Tasks



? Find trending or high-quality content that fits our ICP

? Update trackers and report daily progress



---



Who We’re Looking For



- Highly detail-oriented and organized

- Quick and clear communicator

- Reliable and consistent in following processes

- Comfortable researching and messaging creators on social media

- Motivated to work in a long-term, stable role

- Strong written English skills



---



Requirements

- Laptop or computer

---



Skills (Required)

---

???? Paid time off



? Flexible working hours

---

title: International Sales & AI Business Development Associate
description:
We are MSTR, an AI software company based in the Netherlands. We build custom AI-driven applications that help businesses work smarter and more intelligently, from first conversation to production-ready product.



Our team has around 16 people: a customer-facing team of six here in the Netherlands, and ten developers based in the Philippines. Right now, all of our sales happen in the Netherlands. We're ready to change that, and we're looking for the person to help us do it.



What this role is:

We're building our international sales track from the ground up, and we're looking for a driven person to lead that effort alongside Tom, our co-founder. Your focus will be on international markets, though you'll occasionally support the Dutch market too, where we use AI to help bridge language and communication gaps.



This is early-stage work. There's no existing international playbook to follow. You'll build it. Tom will be involved in calls and strategy, but the initiative and day-to-day hustle is yours.



What you'll actually be doing:

- Reaching out to prospects via phone,
, LinkedIn, and whatever creative approaches you come up with

- Building and running AI-powered lead generation pipelines

- Creating marketing materials that help us tell our story

- Challenging our thinking and bringing new ideas to the table

- Growing into a genuine AI expert who can have real conversations with business owners about what's possible



Who we're looking for:

Someone who communicates exceptionally well in English, is comfortable reaching out cold, and gets genuinely excited about building something new rather than maintaining something existing. You pick up new things fast, you're curious about AI and what it can do for businesses, and you want a role where your results are visible and your responsibility grows with them.



Experience in sales helps, but it's not the point. The right attitude, communication skills, and willingness to figure things out matter far more.



We assess candidates through a short video introduction rather than long application forms. If this sounds interesting, send us a 3 to 7 minute video answering:

1. A brief intro about yourself and what drives you

2. Your experience with talking to clients, selling, or any customer-facing work

3. What excites you about working at an AI company right now

4. How you approach learning something completely new

5. What you're looking for in your next role and where you see yourself long-term



No polish needed. We're looking for clarity, energy, and authenticity. Please don't read from a script.

Upload your video to Google Drive, Dropbox, or YouTube (unlisted) and share the link. Optionally include your CV or LinkedIn.



Please send everything to 
 are happy to answer any questions.



We are looking forward to hearing from you.

title: AML Consultant (Full time, Remote Work)
description:
AML Consultant

Location: Philippines

Type: Full time, remote

Contract: 8 months fixed term



We are a growing and collaborative compliance team supporting regulated businesses across multiple jurisdictions. We are looking for an experienced AML Consultant based in the Philippines to join us on an 8 month fixed term contract, with the possibility of extension depending on business needs at the time.



This is a full time, fully remote role offering strong team support, meaningful work, and ongoing learning opportunities.



What you will be doing

- Assisting with the development and review of AML risk assessments

- Drafting, updating, and maintaining AML policies, procedures, and related compliance documentation

- Translating regulatory requirements into clear, practical written materials

- Supporting compliance frameworks aligned to New Zealand and Australian AML legislation

- Collaborating with internal stakeholders to ensure documentation is accurate, consistent, and fit for purpose



What we are looking for

- Proven experience working in AML or financial crime compliance

- Strong understanding of AML legislation and regulatory expectations

- Demonstrated experience with risk assessments and policy or procedure writing

- Excellent written communication skills with the ability to produce clear, structured documents

- Strong attention to detail and analytical thinking

- Ability to work independently in a remote environment while engaging effectively with a distributed team



What we offer

- Full time remote work from the Philippines

- A supportive team environment with access to guidance and peer review

- Exposure to complex and meaningful AML work across multiple jurisdictions

- Ongoing learning and professional development opportunities

title: Web Developer
description:
We are looking for a Web Developer with strong SEO awareness to build, optimize, and maintain high-performance websites that scale in search visibility and technical quality.



You will work closely with SEO strategists, content teams, and designers to ensure that websites are crawlable, indexable, fast, and semantically structured, while maintaining clean code and excellent user experience.



Responsibilities

 • Develop and maintain websites with SEO-first architecture and clean HTML structure

 • Implement technical SEO best practices (Core Web Vitals, crawl efficiency, indexing control)

 • Optimize page speed, rendering, and server responses (CWV, lazy loading, caching)

 • Ensure proper use of semantic HTML (H1–H6 hierarchy, internal linking, contextual components)

 • Implement and maintain structured data (JSON-LD)

 • Work with log files, redirects, canonicals, pagination, and hreflang

 • Collaborate with SEO teams on scalable, programmatic page generation

 • Identify and fix technical SEO issues across large websites



Requirements

 • Strong experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern web standards

 • Experience with WordPress or similar CMS platforms

 • Solid understanding of technical SEO fundamentals

 • Familiarity with Core Web Vitals, Lighthouse, and PageSpeed Insights

 • Ability to work on large websites with thousands of URLs

 • Attention to detail and clean, maintainable code practices



Nice to Have

 • Experience with programmatic SEO or large-scale content systems

 • Knowledge of server-side rendering, caching layers, or CDN setups

 • Familiarity with SEO tools (Search Console, log analysis, crawlers)



This role is ideal for a developer who understands that code quality, performance, and SEO are deeply connected, and wants to build websites that perform well both for users and search engines.

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: Paralegal/Contract Administrator
description:
Paralegal / Contract Administrator

Boutique Entertainment Law Firm | Remote (PST Hours)

The Role

Join a high-energy, fast-paced transactional office at the heart of the entertainment industry. We handle film/TV production legal, finance, IP, publishing and talent representation. This isn't a 9-to-5 "paper-filing" job; we need a "Closer"—someone who thrives on the adrenaline of high-volume deal flow and moves agreements from first draft to execution with zero errors.

Key Responsibilities

Deal Flow Management: Track intake and manage the entire contract lifecycle; ensure no deadlines or "windows" are missed.

Drafting & Redlining: Prepare first-pass production documents, quality-check redlines, and manage corporate governance filings. Legal summaries, memo and audits.

Signature Administration: Own the DocuSign process; relentlessly follow up with clients, agents, and opposing counsel to break administrative logjams.

IP & Closings: Coordinate copyright/IP documentation and compile comprehensive "Closing Bibles."

Office Liaison: Manage appointment coordination,
 tracking, and database audits and updates to keep the practice organized.

Qualifications

Certification: Proven paralegal training and valid certificate holder.

Experience: Direct experience in contract deal flow, redlining, and IP administration is required.

Tech Stack: Expert proficiency in MS Word (Advanced Redlines), Adobe, Google Calendar, Dropbox, and DocuSign.

Attributes: Highly dependable and punctual; must be able to take initiative and work independently under strict timelines.

The Ideal Candidate

High EQ:Able to navigate high-stakes, high-pressure negotiations with a "thick skin."

Hyyper-Organized: Can prioritize a messy deal sheet and identify immediate "must-signs."

Results-Oriented: You don't just track tasks; you ensure the deal gets done.

How to Apply

Please submit a CV and  a non-AI generated cover letter detailing:

1. Why you are the right fit for a fast-paced entertainment office.

2. The specific training that sets you apart.

3. Your proposed work schedule (based on PST) and 

4. your long-term professional goals.
salary: $850 per month  to start plus bonuses

title: Credit Officer & Loan Processor
description:
About the Role



The client is an integrated residential property business, working hand in hand with their clients to provide property buying, advisory and management services, and investment funds. As a Credit Officer & Loan Processor, you will play a key role in supporting the end-to-end loan lifecycle — from credit assessment through to settlement and post-closing activities.



This is a combined role responsible for reviewing and assessing loan applications in line with company credit policy, while also managing the operational processing and documentation requirements of each loan. You will work closely with clients, brokers, sales teams, and internal operations stakeholders to ensure applications are assessed accurately, processed efficiently, and maintained in full compliance with responsible lending regulations. If you are highly detail-oriented, analytical, and thrive in a fast-paced financial services environment, we’d love to meet you.







Key Responsibilities



Credit Assessment



Review all loan applications and assess suitability in accordance with internal credit policy.

Analyse financial information and supporting documentation to determine applicant eligibility.

Complete formal credit assessments and provide recommendations to the GM – Deployment.

Ensure sound credit decision-making aligned with responsible lending standards.



Loan Processing & Operations



Support the end-to-end loan application process from submission to settlement.

Complete accurate data entry and maintain updated loan files.

Order property valuations and gather required supporting documentation.

Prepare loan files for assessment and approval.



Loan Documentation Management



Prepare, manage, and track loan documentation.

Ensure all required documents are accurate, compliant, and complete.

Obtain required signatures and submit applications correctly and within required timelines.



Stakeholder Liaison



Coordinate with clients, brokers, sales teams, and operations tea
mbers to progress applications.

Provide clear and timely updates on loan status.

Proactively identify and resolve issues that may delay approvals or settlements.



Compliance & Legal Requirements



Ensure all activities comply with responsible lending regulations and internal compliance standards.

Maintain accurate and compliant loan records.

Support brokers with internal compliance documentation requirements.



Customer Service



Respond promptly to customer inquiries and provide professional, helpful support.

Build and maintain strong client relationships throughout the loan process.

Deliver a high level of service to both internal and external stakeholders.



Post-Closing Activities



Follow up on loan lodgements and settlement progress.

Process loan discharges and organise settlements in accordance with procedures.

Assist with servicing calculations and operational loan tasks as required.



System & Database Maintenance



Maintain accurate client records within CRM/database systems.

Ensure all documentation is uploaded and tracked appropriately.

HubSpot experience is highly regarded.



Other Responsibilities



You will coordinate with the Property Management Team to ensure that requests and concerns are properly addressed.

Perform other related tasks and duties that may be assigned by the client later on.



About You



Fluent written and spoken English.

At least 3–5 years’ experience in credit assessment, loan processing, or financial services roles.

Strong understanding of responsible lending regulations and credit policy frameworks.

Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail.

Ability to manage multiple applications and deadlines simultaneously.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Experience in residential property lending or mortgage processing is highly regarded.

HubSpot or CRM experience is a plus.

Proactive, organised, and solutions-focused mindset.



Finer Details



Schedule: 7am - 4pm PHT, Mon - Fri



Start Date: TBD

title: Senior Business Development Manager, Manila/Bulacan
description:
About TrustClub

TrustClub is an invite-only trust network that allows strangers to trust each other and helps businesses reduce risk and increase profitability. Members earn and use Trust Points to access services, loans, jobs and other opportunities.

We are a UK based technology startup business with the goal of creating a global network of trusted members who do better in life, because others can trust them. We are growing our network in the Philippines and seeking local managers to drive adoption.



Currently backed by Antler UK. 



Role

You will build partnerships and recruit members to TrustClub in Bulacan first, then train local teams, move on to other Provinces within the Philippines and in the future, potentially abroad.



The role requires entrepreneurial drive and the ability to pitch and teach how a high trust environment benefits communities and businesses.



Key Responsibilities

Oversee onboarding local businesses and community leaders as TrustClub partners

Represent TrustClub at local events and organise events for TrustClub

Oversee onboarding of new members and teaching of the Trust Principles

Train local teams, first in Bulacan then in other provinces in the Philippines & abroad

Collect feedback from users and help shape TrustClub’s strategy



Requirements

Fluent in English, both spoken and written

Based in Manila or Bulacan, with knowledge of business networks and communities

Proven entrepreneurial mindset; ideally has run or managed a business

5 Years of experience in business development or sales

Self-starter who can operate with minimal supervision (very important, we want proactive people)

Bonus: Familiarity with lending, microfinance, BNPL, or community financing



Work Setup and Compensation

Base stipend: Php 30,000/month to 60,000/month

Commission income: Potential for additional Php 80,
,000/month

Includes flexible work-from-home, field work in the province and calls at evening hours



Send your application to

USE JOB CODE : 101024



Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

We are only looking for candidates who are innately interested in joining us and sees the vision. Not mass job application. Our CEO mantra: If you do not know the job and company well enough, please do not apply.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager 

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager 

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours  



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision 

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business. 



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us! 



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager. 



 Role Purpose 

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling. 



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role. 



What Success Looks Like 

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it. 



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth. 



Primary Objectives 

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights 

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages 

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy 

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS 



Regular Work Activities 

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards 

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning 

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights 

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic 

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding 

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements 

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards 

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts 

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals 

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data 

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows 

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules 

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads 

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability 

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality 



Key Skills 

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows) 

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD) 

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills 

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management 

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS 

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills 

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability 

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast 

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams 

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques 



People Contacts and Interactions 

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap 

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs 

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy 

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews 



Role Requirements 

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns 

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards) 

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments 

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones 

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets 

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting 

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization 

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership 

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing 



How to Apply:

Click the link - 

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant

Reports To: CEO

Work Hours: Philippines daytime work hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision:

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go getters, people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies and will be continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.

At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family in both our internal and customer facing sides. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!

That’s where you come in as our next Amazon Fee & Unit Economics Management Accountant



Role Purpose

Own, track, and optimize every cost that impacts Amazon unit economics, so leadership always has a clear, accurate, and optimized view of true ASIN-level profitability.



What Success Looks Like:

Success in this role means true Amazon profitability is no longer a guessing game. Every ASIN has a fully loaded cost that includes product cost, shipping, duties, Amazon fees, affiliate commissions, and ranking-related marketing spend. Leadership can confidently d
 which products to scale, reprice, suppress, liquidate, or discontinue based on real data — not blended averages or assumptions.



A top performer in this role consistently reduces total Amazon unit costs while improving cost visibility. Through tight auditing, proactive fee recovery, smarter shipping and duty tracking, and disciplined attribution of affiliate and ranking spend, this role directly increases contribution margin without increasing ad spend or revenue risk.



Primary Objectives

• Amazon Fee, Shipping & Cost Auditing

Own end-to-end auditing of all Amazon, logistics, and ranking-related costs.

• Fully Loaded ASIN-Level Unit Economics

Maintain accurate per-unit costs including shipping, duties, fees, affiliates, and marketing.

• Cost Optimization & Reduction

Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities across fees, logistics, and promotional spend.

• Profitability & Decision Support

Provide leadership with clean, reliable Amazon cost and margin reporting.



Regular Work Activities

• Audit all Amazon FBA fees (pick/pack, weight, storage, returns)

• Track short-term and long-term storage fees by ASIN

• Monitor aged inventory fees and cost exposure

• Track AWD inbound, storage, and handling fees

• Reconcile inbound placement fees

• Track removal, disposal, and liquidation costs

• Track international shipping costs (factory ? port ? Amazon)

• Allocate shipping cost per unit by shipment and ASIN

• Track duties, tariffs, customs, and brokerage fees

• Maintain landed cost per unit calculations

• Track affiliate commissions tied to Amazon sales

• Attribute affiliate spend at ASIN or product-group level

• Track ranking, launch, and promotional marketing costs

• Identify unprofitable or fee-heavy SKUs

• Submit and track Amazon reimbursement claims

• Create monthly Amazon cost & margin reports

• Monitor fee and cost trend anomalies

• Maintain SOPs for Amazon cost tracking and audits



Key Skills Required

• Understanding & ability to learn Amazon FBA fee structures

• Strong grasp of landed cost accounting

• Advanced spreadsheet skills

• Experience with SKU-level profitability modeling

• Strong analytical and investigative mindset

• High attention to detail

• Ability to reconcile complex datasets

• Process-driven

• Cost-reduction oriented thinking

• Clear written & verbal communication



People Contacts and Interactions – What are the primary people contacts in this job (who, why, and how often)?

• Direct report to the CEO

• Frequent communication with

• Operations Team

• Logistics Team



Role Requirements

Experience, Training, and Education

• 2+ years working with Amazon Seller Central data

• Experience tracking shipping, duties, and landed costs

• Familiarity with FBA, AWD, and storage fee structures

• Advanced spreadsheet proficiency required

• E-commerce or marketplace finance experience preferred

• Experience submitting Amazon reimbursement claims preferred

• Comfortable owning ASIN-level economics end-to-end

• Strong personal accountability

• Not responsible for tax, payroll, AR/AP, or general bookkeeping



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-AGUZM8V3D/landing?u=
ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Growth Executive - Palayan/Cabanatuan
description:
**Important** - Must be based in these locations:



Cabanatuan. Palayan City, Laur and the other surrounding towns. 



About TrustClub



TrustClub is building a global network of trust – where reputation becomes currency.

We help people and small businesses access opportunities, loans, and partnerships based on trust, not paperwork.

We believe trust should be profitable, and that communities grow stronger when people vouch for each other.



Ultimately higher trust means people can work with each other more easily and everyone gets richer. This is true across the world and we are starting with the Philippines, one town at a time.



Your Mission



Be the face of TrustClub in your community. Inspire people to believe in trust again – show that keeping your word creates real opportunity. Grow local networks, onboard partners, and make “trust” go viral in your area.



Where we are currently:



We already have traction in Palayan City with a brilliant Growth Manager already doing great things, working closely with both business and political leaders across multiple communities. We are ambitious though and need another outgoing, organised and confident tea
mber to join us. We want to make the city and surrounding areas one of the great economic stories. With high trust between people and businesses, we believe everyone can end up richer, happier and more successful.



What You’ll Do



- Launch and grow local TrustClub communities

- Organize small events and tell inspiring local stories

- Onboard and build partnerships with small businesses and local leaders

- Build social media presence and engagement

- Share feedback to shape our growth playbook

- Help businesses grow with Loans & BNPL



You Might Be a Great Fit If You



- Are respected and well-connected in your community

- Believe deeply in fairness and cooperation

- Have experience in community building or local marketing

- Are active on social media and love storytelling

- Want to help people rise together through trust

- Good English



Success Looks Like (in one month)



- 1,000+ new members in your area

- 10+ local business partnerships

- Stories of trust that spread online



What We Offer



- Base pay plus growth bonuses

- Path to leadership

- The chance to change how the world measures trust

- The opportunity to change your region for the better

title: High-Volume DTC Graphic Designer (A-Players Only)
description:
Are you a visual storyteller who understands that a great ad isn't just "pretty"—it’s a conversion machine? We are looking for a relentless, precision-oriented DTC Graphic Designer to join our creative engine.



We don't do "slow." We do high-quality, high-velocity testing. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can churn out winning variations without breaking a sweat (or missing a detail), we want you.



The Mission

You will be responsible for executing 3–5 creative batches per day. We provide the high-level strategy, a preference ad/reference, and the copy via ClickUp. Your job is to take those ingredients and bake 4–5 high-performing variations and hooks for each.



What You’ll Be Doing

Rapid Batch Production: Designing 4–5 variations per concept, focusing on different visual hooks, layouts, and call-to-actions.



Whitelisting Design: Creating authentic, "native-feeling" ads specifically for whitelisted creator content.



AI Integration: Leveraging AI tools (Midjourney, Adobe Firefly, Magnific, etc.) to extend backgrounds, enhance image quality, or generate assets to speed up your workflow.



Tool Mastery: Working seamlessly between Figma (for layout/speed) and Photoshop (for high-end manipulation and grit).



Systematic Execution: Managing your workflow entirely within ClickUp, ensuring every sub-task is checked and every asset is exported correctly.



Who You Are (The "A-Player" Checklist)

DTC Obsessed: You understand the nuances of
, Instagram, and TikTok ads. You know what a "scroll-stopper" actually looks like.



Speed & Precision: You can execute quickly without making sloppy mistakes. Alignment, font consistency, and brand guidelines are second nature to you.



Accountable & Reliable: You don't need a babysitter. You hit your daily batch targets, communicate clearly, and own your deadlines.



Future-Proof: You have experience using AI to optimize your design process and create higher-quality assets in less time.



Requirements

Proven experience designing Static Ads for DTC brands.



Specific experience creating Whitelisting/Creator-style ad layouts.



Proficiency in Figma and Photoshop.



Familiarity with AI design tools to enhance creative output.



Ability to handle a high volume of work (3–5 batches daily).



How to Apply

We are looking for quality over quantity in applications. To be considered, please submit:



A link to your portfolio (specifically highlighting DTC static ads and whitelisting examples).



A brief mention of which AI tools you use in your current workflow.



The word "EXECUTION" at the top of your application so we know you pay attention to detail.

- Learn the Playbook – Understand our category strategy, operating standards, and decision frameworks

- Apply the Playbook – Execute accurately and consistently to deliver predictable, scalable results

title: Client Success Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,100 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



Client Support (maintaining 40-50 total clients):



- Run kickoff calls with new clients using our proven script

- Review client content and give actionable feedback

- Answer client messages within 24 hours

- Host weekly group calls and 1-on-1 coaching sessions

- Help clients overcome content blocks and limiting beliefs



Progress Tracking:



- Update daily/weekly reports

- Track client progress and next steps

- Join daily team check-ins

- Ensure clients follow strategies consistently



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)



- C1+ English (written and spoken) with no accent

- Strong communication skills

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment



IMPORTANT



When recording a Loom video as part of your application:



- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Content creation and social media experience

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

- Regular usage of AI tools (ChatGPT, CapCut)



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $935 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,100 a month)

Note: More experienced CSMs earn between $1,800 and $2,500 after 6-12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $900+ additional monthly based on:

- Client retention rates

- Task completion metrics

- Quality of feedback

- Team collaboration

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise directly to your bank

- Tools access: We'll cover all the needed tools

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Regular feedback and skill development



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CSM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with client management.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio.



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.

title: Creative Strategist (Paid Ads) – Agent Taylor (Premium Hair Tools)
description:
About Us

Agent Taylor is a fast-growing D2C brand selling premium hair tools across Europe. We scale through high-performing direct response creatives on Meta & TikTok.



Your Role

Own the creative strategy for paid ads: research our target audience, define winning angles/hooks, write clear briefs for creators/editors, and iterate on what converts. This is strategy, not just ideas.



What You’ll Do



Translate customer insights into ad angles, hooks, and scripts



Build weekly creative briefs for UGC & ad variations



Analyze winners/losers and iterate fast



Align creatives with brand aesthetics (premium, trustworthy, native to TikTok/Meta)



Who We’re Looking For



Proven experience creating winning ad strategies for beauty/hair/skincare brands



Deep understanding of our target customer’s pains, desires, and triggers



Performance-minded (hooks, retention, proof, CTA)



Strong communicator with editors/creators



Bonus: you are part of the target audience and can deeply relate to the problem



Important

Fast testing environment. Missed deadlines, vague briefs, or ideas without data = not a fit.



Paid Test (Mandatory)

Short strategy task (angles + hooks for Agent Taylor) before hiring.



Long-Term

If it works: ongoing strategy ownership, weekly output, and growth in scope & pay.

title: Senior Direct Response Creative Strategist (Ecommerce Performance)
description:
We run performance-driven ecommerce brands across multiple markets.



We do NOT need:



Canva editors



Social media managers



Trend recyclers



ChatGPT idea generators



We are looking for someone who understands:



Direct response psychology



Belief shifts



Angle development



Mechanism-based marketing



Creative hit-rate optimization



Performance metrics (CTR, CPA, CVR, AOV)



If you don’t understand those terms deeply, this role is not for you.



???? WHAT YOU WILL DO



Develop high-converting creative briefs



Build unique angles competitors are not using



Improve creative hit-rate across products



Research customer psychology deeply



Structure systematic testing frameworks



Work closely with media buying team



This is NOT a content role.

This is a performance role.



???? REQUIREMENTS



You must:



Have worked on ecommerce performance ads



Understand paid ads metrics



Explain why ads work (not just “because hook is good”)



Be able to analyze competitors deeply



Think in hypotheses, not vibes



???? MANDATORY APPLICATION STEPS



If you do not follow these steps, your application will be ignored.



Record a 5–8 minute Loom video:



Pick any competitor ad in ecommerce.



Break down:



The angle



The belief shift



The mechanism



Why it converts



How you would improve it



Provide your framework for increasing creative hit-rate.



Give 3 different angles for this product:

(We will provide product link)



No generic ChatGPT answers.

No copy-paste portfolios.



???? COMPENSATION



Base salary: $2,000 – $2,800 / month (based on experience)



Performance bonus:



$500 bonus when 2+ creatives hit scaling KPIs



$1,000 bonus when 5+ creatives hit scaling KPIs



Additional bonus tied to revenue lift above baseline



30-day paid trial first.

Full-time role after proven performance.



???? WHO THIS IS FOR



This is for someone who:



Thinks like a growth operator



Wants ownership



Cares about performance, not aesthetics



Wants long-term upside



If you just want a safe VA job, this is not it.

title: Senior Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

- Flag discrepancies or unusual transactions for review by the CFO



What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Experience handling multi-entity, multi-currency financial data preferred

- Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

- Fluent in English, both written and spoken



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

- Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

- Full-time opportunity

- Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

- Competitive pay

- Training and growth opportunities

- Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



Salary range

- Php 40, 000 - Php 65,000 (based on experience)



Application Instructions

Please go to the link below, review the questions carefully, and share the required information.
