title: Google Ads Specialist (Shopify + GA4) — WFO
description:
(a) About the role



We run two established pet businesses (e-commerce + veterinary clinic) with a deep base of warm customers. We are hiring a Google specialist to own our Google Ads + measurement stack end-to-end.



We are already spending on Google. Your first mission is to audit and fix our setup quickly, so we stop waste and can trust our tracking.



(b) What you will own



Google Ads (across all inventories)

- Manage and optimize campaigns across Search / Shopping / Performance Max / Display / YouTube

- Set clear campaign goals (sales/conversions) and control budget allocation

- Build and maintain clean account structure, audiences, and exclusions

- Improve efficiency and incrementality (not vanity reach)



Measurement (critical)

- Set up or fix GA4 for Shopify (and GTM if needed)

- Ensure conversion tracking is correct (no duplicates/wrong conversions)

- Enforce UTM discipline + build a simple weekly dashboard

- Document the setup so it stays clean long-term

- Audit our current campaigns and recommend what to pause/keep (fast)

- Improve account structure and spend efficiency

title: Experienced Data Engineer / Web Scraping / Automation Engineer / Full-Stack or Backend Developer / Python
description:
Hey there smarty pants!



My name is Jason and I run one of the top eBay shoe stores in the US for men's and women's shoes for over 6 years. Think of your Nike's, Asics, Adidas, Hoka, etc. I am looking to bring on an experienced technical person to join our small, but intimate team.



Current Challenge:



We use many different supplier websites to fulfill our orders, and this list is growing. We don't use huge ecommerce websites like Amazon, Walmart, or Walmart, our main suppliers are shoe retailers like Nike, Finishline, FootLocker, and even small mom and pop shoe stores that host their website using Shopify. However, everything is done manually by our team, meaning every day, we need to go on the supplier website, check price and inventory levels, and then manually update our listings on eBay. This process is not only time consuming, it regularly causes issues such as missing a sale/markdown, selling shoes that are already out of stock, and prevents us from reaching higher levels as add more shoes means more time added to updating our price and stock levels. 



Who We Are Looking For:



We want to optimize and automate our price and stock checking process as much as possible. If you've built and maintained web scrapers at scale, understand the full web scraping stack (proxies, browser automation, parsing, anti-bot bypass), an expert in organizing scraped data in a spreadsheet, can make smart decisions about tools and costs, or if all this web scraping talk is a piece of cake for you based on your technical skill level, you are who we are looking for.



As I said before, we use a lot of different supplier websites, so each website will need its own solution. Some are difficult to scrape, some are easy, some requires you to add item to cart before getting price. If you completely understand what I am talking about and you are already thinking of solutions in your head, please keep reading..



Must Have's:



3-5+ years of professional working experience in web scraping, data engineering, full-stack/backend development, or automation engineering, basically, work where building scrapers would be an easy straightforward task, not a stretch.



Proficient in Python and/or JavaScript (Node.js):

- Most scraping work is done in Python (BeautifulSoup, Scrapy, Playwright, requests) or JavaScript (Puppeteer, Playwright)

- You need to be able to write real code, not just use no-code tools



Deep understanding of the web scraping stack

- Fetching (HTTP requests, headless browsers, Playwright/Puppeteer)

- Anti-bot bypass (proxies, residential IPs, fingerprinting, CAPTCHAs)

- Parsing (CSS selectors, XPath, or AI-based extraction)

- Scheduling and orchestration

- You know when to use what, and why



Strong Google Sheets and Google Apps Script skills:

- This is important. The logic layer and dashboard will live in Google Sheets.

- You should be comfortable building complex formulas, data transformations, and automated workflows in Sheets

- You should be able to write Apps Script to process data, run calculations, trigger actions, and connect to external APIs

- If you've built systems where Google Sheets is the "brain" that processes incoming data and outputs decisions — that's exactly what I need

- I'm not looking for someone who thinks Sheets is "just a spreadsheet." I need someone who knows how to make it do real work.



Familiarity with modern tools and services:

- You know what Apify, Bright Data, ScraperAPI, Browse AI, etc. are

- You understand the tradeoffs between building custom vs using services

- You can make smart decisions about cost vs complexity



Cost-conscious mindset:

- I need someone who thinks about "what's the cheapest way to reliably solve this", not "what's the most technically impressive"

- We will be making a lot of requests, so we must keep variable costs as low as possible.



API integration experience:

- You've connected systems together via APIs before

- You don't need eBay-specific experience, but you should be comfortable figuring it out



Ability to be self-directed and own your decisions

- I'll explain the business requirements and any context needed. You figure out and build the technical approach/solution.

- I'm not a developer, nor is anyone else on the team. We need someone who can make decisions, not just take orders and wait for instructions.



Bonus

- Professional experience with AI/LLM automation or integration

- Familiarity with eBay backend/API



Day-to-Day:



You will be building web scrapers (or any other solutions) to get data we need for update-to-date price/stock levels and then maintaining these scrapers, fixing any alerts/flags that pop. You will also be building and maintaining the logic layer in Google Sheets & Google Apps Script. This layer contains the complex logic, formulas, and automations that turn the raw scraped data into useful information that will be displayed in the command layer. You will also be building and maintaining the command layer dashboard for all tea
mbers to use. This layer will show the useful information such as final price, best supplier, stock levels, any alerts/items that need attention. You will also be building and maintaining the automation to eBay, making sure that all price and stock changes from each scrape cycle is automatically updating our eBay listings smoothly.  



Long story short, you will be in charge of making sure that our process from building the scrapers for each website to automating our eBay listings is running smoothly.



Once this upfront work is finished and we are in maintenance mode, we will be using your expertise to automate other processes our business. At the end of the day, our business is very simple and don't take much technical knowledge to  automate.



Logistics & Salary:



- Full-time, fully remote,

- Preferably Mon-Fri (PST), especially in the beginning, but can be negotiable

- Communication through Slack

- Ready to begin immediately

- Salary ranging anywhere from $5-$12 USD per hour, of course, all based on experience



Final Remarks:



If any of this sounds confusing, or worse, you don't even have at least 3 year of actual working professional experience (one-time projects do not count), please do not apply as we will be wasting our times. After all, for the person who is truly experienced, web scraping is a quite the low level skill, even for complex websites with anti bot technology. So, if you are a person who has worked in environments where much higher technical skills were required from you than simple web scraping and data organization, you are someone we would love to add to our team!



How To Apply:



Please don't send me a generic cover letter or your life story. I just want to see that you've done this kind of work, or work that would make this look like a walk in the park. I also want you to see your ability to think though the problem. Send me:



- A brief intro: who you are, where you're based, and why you think you are perfect for this role

- Relevant experience(s): any professional working experience, no one off projects or experiences that has nothing to do with what I am looking for

- Your approach: briefly tell me in your own words/understanding what the issue is with my currently process and how you would approach solving this issue

- Your rate: whatever you prefer, just give me a ballpark if you are unsure



Message me with the subject line "GSTEAM AUTOMATOR". Subject lines without this will be ignored. Also, DO NOT SEND
S, I will not respond.



If something in this post is unclear, please feel free to ask, I would be glad to clarify.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Website Developer
description:
Website Developer — Ongoing Maintenance & Bug Fixes (HTML/CSS/JS)

 



POSITION: Website Developer / Maintainer (Part-Time, Ongoing)



HOURS: 5–10 hours/week (flexible, task-based)



PAY: $5–8/hour USD (negotiable based on experience)



START DATE: Immediately



 



ABOUT THE ROLE



My previous developer has passed away and I need someone to take over maintenance of my business website — 
.



The site is a custom-built HTML/CSS/JavaScript website (NOT WordPress). 



It includes ------>



• A landing page with marketing copy

• A 15-question quiz that calculates a score and sends results via

• A book download page that sends PDFs via an automated
 sequence

• A waitlist/signup page

• Login functionality for returning users



The site is live and mostly working, but has several bugs that need fixing urgently, plus ongoing maintenance going forward.



IMMEDIATE TASKS (First Week) --------->



1. QUIZ BUG FIX (URGENT): The sovereignty assessment quiz loads and accepts answers but fails at the results stage. It does not calculate or display the score, and does not send the results
. This is the most urgent fix.



2. BOOK LINK SECURITY: The free books (PDFs) are currently accessible via direct URL without going through the website or providing an
. Example: 
/books/exit atlas final.pdf — anyone with the link can download without signing up. I need these links protected so books are only accessible after providing an
 address.



3. WAITING LIST BUTTON: There is a red "Join the Waiting List" button in the automated
 sequence that is not linked to anything. It needs to connect to a page where users can enter their name,
, and a comment about what they need help with.



4.
 FORMATTING: There is a character encoding error in one of the automated
s — a strange symbol appears before the pound sign (£). Needs fixing.



5. ADD SUBSTACK LINK: Add a link to my Substack newsletter (
) somewhere appropriate on the site — likely the footer or a dedicated section.



ONGOING TASKS (After First Week) ---------->



• Fix bugs as they arise

• Make content updates (text changes, new pages)

• Potentially add Stripe payment integration

• Potentially embed video content on the website

• Monitor site uptime and
 deliverability

• General maintenance and improvements as needed



REQUIREMENTS 



• Strong HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills

• Experience with
 APIs (SendGrid, Mailchimp, ConvertKit, or similar)

• Comfortable reading and working with someone else's codebase

• Experience with web hosting (Netlify, Vercel, DigitalOcean, AWS, or similar)

• Able to troubleshoot and debug existing code

• Responsive communication (reply within 24 hours on working days)

• Reliable internet connection



NICE TO HAVE (not required)



• Experience with Stripe payment integration

• Experience with PDF generation or delivery

• Experience with quiz/assessment functionality

• Familiarity with DNS management and domain configuration



HOW TO APPLY



Please reply with ------------>



1. A brief introduction and your relevant experience

2. Examples of websites you have built or maintained (links preferred)

3. Your experience with HTML/CSS/JS — specifically with debugging existing code you did not write

4. Your experience with
 services (SendGrid, Mailchimp, etc.)

5. Your hourly rate expectation (USD)

6. Your availability — how quickly could you start, and how many hours per week are you available?

7. A brief description of how you would approach taking over a website from a previous developer with no handover documentation



This is an ongoing role. I need someone reliable who can maintain and improve this website long-term. The immediate priority is fixing the bugs listed above, but there will be continuous work after that.



I value clear communication, reliability, and attention to detail.

title: Short-Form TikTok Video Editor (CapCut + AI Tools) – E-Commerce Ads
description:
We are a U.S.-based e-commerce brand looking for a detail-oriented short-form video editor to produce TikTok-style performance ads (10–20 seconds).



This role is execution-focused.

You will NOT be responsible for strategy, scripting, or marketing decisions.



You will receive:

• Pre-written hooks

• Raw UGC footage (dogs + product)

• Clear structure templates

• Direct instructions



Your job is to create multiple variations quickly and cleanly.



?



Responsibilities



• Edit 10–20 second vertical videos (9:16 format)

• Add bold, readable captions

• Swap different hooks into the same base footage

• Create multiple variations per video

• Keep pacing fast and native to TikTok

• Export properly formatted files

• Label files clearly (Example: Hook1_V1.mp4)



?



AI Tools (Preferred but Not Required)



You should be comfortable using AI tools such as:



• CapCut AI features

• ElevenLabs (voiceovers)

• HeyGen (basic use)

• Runway or similar tools



AI will be used to:

• Test different voiceovers

• Generate alternate hook variations

• Create simple UGC-style variations



Important: Videos must feel natural and not overly artificial.



?



Requirements



• Strong CapCut editing skills (required)

• Experience editing short-form TikTok or Reels ads

• Good pacing instincts

• Fast turnaround (24–48 hrs per batch)

• Ability to follow exact instructions

• Organized file management



Bonus:

• Experience editing direct-response ads

• Familiarity with TikTok Shop content



?



Project Structure



Initial test project:

• 15–20 short video variations

• Paid per batch



If performance and communication are strong:

• Ongoing monthly work available



?



This Role Is NOT:



• Not influencer content creation

• Not cinematic storytelling

• Not YouTube editing

• Not creative strategy

• Not social media management



This is a short-form ad production role.



?



To Apply



Please include:

 1. 3 short-form TikTok-style edits (10–20 sec)

 2. Confirmation you use CapCut

 3. Your rate for 20 short videos

 4. Your turnaround time



Applications without samples will not be reviewed.

When hospices do not have nurses available to take care of their dying patient's they call companies like mine to ask us to send nurses 24 hours a day for a few days while their patient's are dying. title: Content Manager
description:
About Us



Lightup Tutoring makes GCSE English feel achievable, confidence-boosting, and genuinely engaging. Through our online platform, The Lightup Hub, we support students with high-quality videos, structured notes, quizzes, and personalised revision plans that actually work.

We’ve already supported over 150,000 students and we’re growing fast. Everything we publish matters because it directly impacts how students learn and how confident they feel walking into exams.

Behind every great lesson is excellent execution. That’s where you come in.



Our Mission



We believe education should feel empowering, not overwhelming. Too many students struggle because content is poorly organised, rushed, or unclear. We’re building a platform where quality, clarity, and consistency come first, so students always know they’re learning from something they can trust.



The Role 



This role owns content delivery end-to-end. You’ll be responsible for making sure every piece of content goes from idea to live on the platform smoothly, on time, and to a very high standard.

You’ll sit at the centre of multiple moving parts. Working closely with the CEO, product, editors, and external contributors, you’ll organise timelines, manage deadlines, format resources, upload content into the Lightup backend, and quality-check everything before it goes live.

If you love organisation, precision, and making complex workflows run like clockwork, this role is for you.



What You’ll Do



Content Operations & Delivery:

1. Own the full lifecycle of content from planning through to publication

2. Manage timelines and deadlines across videos, quizzes, PDFs, and revision resources

3. Coordinate filming schedules and content creation with the CEO and contributors

4. Liaise with external creators when needed to ensure content is delivered on time



Content Formatting & Uploading:

1. Format learning resources including PowerPoints and PDFs to match Lightup standards

2. Upload videos, quizzes, and written content into the Lightup backend

3. Ensure all content follows the correct structure and naming conventions



Quality Assurance

1. Proofread all content for spelling, grammar, clarity, and accuracy

2. Check that GCSE English terminology and explanations are precise and correct

3. QA content post-upload to ensure everything works properly and displays correctly

4. Spot errors before students ever see them



Organisation & Ownership

1. Create and maintain clear content trackers and delivery schedules

2. Proactively identify risks, bottlenecks, or missing pieces and resolve them early

3. Orchestrate multiple contributors while keeping standards high

4. Take full ownership of content delivery without needing close supervision



Who We’re Looking For



Must have:

1. Experience in content management, or production management

2. Strong experience coordinating and leading projects with multiple stakeholders

3. Exceptional written English and proofreading ability



Nice to have:

1. Experience in education or edtech

2. Experience working with learning platforms or CMS systems

3. Previous operation business administration 



Who You Are:

1. Highly organised and process-driven

2. Extremely detail-oriented with a low tolerance for errors

3. Confident managing deadlines and holding others accountable

4. Comfortable working autonomously with high responsibility

5. Calm, reliable, and precise under pressure

6. Passionate about producing high-quality educational content



Why This Role Matters:

This role is critical to Lightup’s success. You’re not just “uploading content”. You’re protecting quality, consistency, and trust. Students rely on what we publish, and you’ll be the person ensuring everything meets the standard they deserve.

If you love making systems work, enjoy ownership, and take pride in flawless execution, you’ll thrive here.



Application: If you are interested in this role, please reach out and we will send you an internal application link for you to complete for consideration by our panel.

title: Amazon Compliance Specialist
description:
Regulatory & Legal Compliance



Conduct in-depth research on FDA, EPA, FTC, and other relevant federal and state regulations.

Ensure compliance with international product safety standards (EU, UK, Canada, Asia-Pacific) when applicable.

Perform ongoing monitoring of regulatory updates and interpret implications for product categories.

Support intellectual property due diligence to prevent patent, copyright, or trademark infringement.



Risk Management & Product Compliance



Evaluate new and existing products for compliance risks and advise stakeholders on mitigation strategies.

Develop compliance testing protocols and coordinate with third-party labs and certification agencies.

Manage corrective actions, recalls, or withdrawals in alignment with Amazon’s policies and legal requirements.

Conduct audits of product listings and seller submissions to prevent unlawful or restricted product selection.



Cross-Functional Collaboration



Partner with Product Development, Supply Chain, and Seller Performance teams to execute compliance initiatives.

Provide clear guidance to vendors, suppliers, and internal teams on compliance requirements.

Train cross-functional stakeholders on compliance best practices and emerging regulatory risks.

Act as a subject matter expert to business teams during product launches, regulatory reviews, and inspections.



Policy & Process Development



Draft and implement compliance procedures, standard operating protocols (SOPs), and escalation processes.

Support automation and system-based compliance controls to scale monitoring and enforcement.

Contribute to internal policy development regarding restricted products, product claims, and safety certifications.

Continuously improve workflows to enhance accuracy, timeliness, and audit readiness.



Documentation & Reporting



Maintain accurate records of compliance assessments, approvals, and regulatory correspondence.

Prepare detailed reports and risk assessments for leadership review.

Provide supervisors with regular feedback on task progress, emerging risks, and resolution status.

Ensure confidentiality of sensitive data, supplier information, and Amazon business strategy.





Experience interacting directly with regulators including federal and state agencies

Experience in research and analyzing federal and state regulations

Familiarity and experience in dealing with FDA regulation is REQUIRED

Familiarity with international compliance frameworks (REACH, RoHS, CE marking).

Experience in compliance auditing, regulatory affairs, or legal review.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

Excellent communication skills for engaging with global teams and regulators.

Ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with strict deadline

title: Client Nurturing Specialist
description:
About Proactive Marketing



The Proactive Marketing mission: “To help Chiropractors build their dream practice while having a positive impact on the health of their patients.”



We not only guarantee the best results for our clients, but we also prioritize building a one-of-a-kind working experience for our team. We are 100% remote, and we encourage our employees to work from anywhere in the world.



We have a strong company culture that focuses on innovation, personal development, leadership, and cultivating a winning environment. We believe that our company is most productive when our employees are fulfilled, challenged, and working to achieve both their personal and professional goals, while constantly striving for their own personal next level.



Our #1 Core Value: Better Than Yesterday



In today’s world taking initiative is a critical component of success. Therefore, we encourage tea
mbers to take initiative in the direction that they see fit so that they can learn valuable lessons along the way and contribute to relevant team goals. We don’t micromanage and we encourage an environment of responsibility and leadership.



About the Role



We are looking for a Client Nurturing Specialist to help manage and protect our client experience behind the scenes.



This role is not sales and not account management — your primary mission is to ensure clients feel supported, tracked, and never forgotten, while reducing administrative workload for our Account Managers so they can focus on high-value conversations and faster response times.



If you are highly organized, process-driven, and naturally attentive to client satisfaction, this role is for you.



Primary Objective



To reduce administrative workload for Account Managers by owning client tracking, follow-ups, and quality control — ultimately improving retention, continuity, and overall client experience.



Key Responsibilities



  -Client Onboarding & Launch Oversight

  -Ensure all clients are fully onboarded within the ideal timeline

  -Confirm that every onboarding and launch call strictly follows SOP

  -Flag missing steps, delays, or process gaps immediately

  -Call Quality Control & Client Sentiment Monitoring

  -Quality check every onboarding and launch call

  -Identify signs of frustration, dissatisfaction, or confusion

  -Proactively alert Account Managers if a client appears unhappy or disengaged

  -Client Retention & Lifecycle Tracking

  -Maintain a clear, up-to-date spreadsheet of:

        -Clients nearing the end of their service term (for retention follow-up)

        -Clients who stopped service (for re-engagement after 1–2 months)

        -Ensure no client reaches an end date without a retention action planned

        -Re-Engagement & Responsiveness Tracking

        -Track clients who become unresponsive

        -Coordinate outreach through different channels 
, Slack, CRM, etc.)

        -Help bring conversations back in sync before issues escalate

        -Internal Coordination

        -Keep Account Managers informed with clear notes, flags, and updates

        -Maintain clean, accurate documentation at all times



What We’re Looking For



 -Extremely detail-oriented and organized

 -Strong follow-up and tracking skills

 -Comfortable reviewing call recordings and SOPs

 -Able to spot emotional cues and early client dissatisfaction

 -Process-driven with a strong sense of ownership

 -Clear written communication skills

 -Experience in client success, operations, VA support, or account coordination is a plus



Why This Role Matters:



 -Your work directly impacts

 -Client satisfaction

 -Client retention

 -Faster response times

 -Better focus for Account Managers

 -A smoother, more professional client experience

 -You are the system behind the relationship.



Role Details



Remote



Full-time / Part-time (adjust as needed)



Long-term opportunity for the right candidate

title: Finance Business Partner
description:
SBFM are the UK’s fastest growing Soft FM service provider. Our success is built upon breaking the outdated modes so 

frequently used in the FM industry and delivering technology led, cost effective service solutions for our clients.



The main purpose of this role is to support the BU by providing best in class business partnering to the Operations 

team, providing MI (including budgets and forecasts) and enabling decision making through financial analysis and

insight. You will be part of a team developing the business’s MI reporting suite and producing the business’s annual 

financial budget & forecasts.



Key Accountabilities:

• Financial analysis

     o Conducting in-depth financial analysis to provide contract insight & support operational decision-making

     o Understanding of contracts being billed including revenue & cost drivers to bridge Margin performance

     o Revenue reporting ensuring accurate & maximised billing is reflected

     o Cost reporting through analysis of payroll & consumables with detailed understanding of variances to 

         budget



• Management Information to deadlines

     o Client/site P&Ls with variance reporting highlighting risks & opportunities to profitability

     o Supporting leadership to understand margins & profitability for all clients and sites within BU

     o Establishing and monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) and developing reporting suite through 

         utilisation of PowerBI



• Business Partnering

     o Working with Operational leads to ensure understanding of margin erosion where applicable and support 

         in any remedial strategies

     o Forecasting any additional revenues and margins

     o Business cases for additional spend and tracking performance to budget

     o Collate and track risks and opportunities to client forecasts 



Skills & Qualities and Experience:

• At least 2+ years' experience in a financial analysis/management accounting role

• Qualified/Part Qualified accountant (ACA/CIMA/ACCA) or QBE

• Highly skilled in Excel functionality & PowerBi

• Able to manage numerous Contracts 

• Excellent attention to detail

• Analytical skills to aid in the review of data

• Able to work to tight and strict deadlines

• Ambitious and enthusiastic towards both your career and projects

• Ability to challenge positively and debate confidently.

• Ability to work openly and collaboratively at all levels

title: Operations & Systems Coordinator
description:
About the Role 



Reports to: Founder / Chief Revenue Officer 



Our client is seeking an Operations & Systems Coordinator to support a growing luxury short-term rental (STR) portfolio in Austin, Texas. We are looking for an “orchestrator”, someone who thrives on building order from chaos, documenting workflows, and helping a founder step out of day-to-day operations. 







You won’t just execute tasks; you will design and improve the infrastructure that makes this business scalable. This role is ideal for a proactive professional who wants to grow into an operational leadership position. 







What You’ll Own 



Systems & SOP Development (Primary Focus) 



Process Documentation: Turn task notes into clean, usable SOPs and checklists for guest experience and property ops. 

Optimization: Identify inefficiencies and proactively recommend workflow improvements. 

Tracking: Build and maintain simple systems (vendor trackers, maintenance logs, escalation dashboards). 

AI Integration: Support the implementation of AI-assisted workflows and operational automation. 



Vendor Coordination & Property Operations 



Scheduling: Coordinate cleaners, maintenance, and specialty vendors (pool, landscaping, etc.). 

Communication: Use text/email for efficiency; make phone calls to US vendors when speed is required. 

Quality Control: Maintain vendor notes, pricing, and performance tracking. 

Triage: Handle maintenance troubleshooting and ensure timely resolutions. 



Guest Operations & Tech Management 



System Oversight: Manage AI messaging tools (Hospitable, HostBuddy) to ensure concierge-level service. 

Escalations: Professionally handle high-risk guest situations and flag risks before they affect reviews. 

Knowledge Base: Maintain property FAQs and internal reference guides. 



Admin & Financial Support 



Daily Reporting: Send structured daily summaries highlighting progress and bottlenecks. 

Finance: Support basic workflows, including vendor payments and expense tracking in QuickBooks. 

Growth: Assist with CRM hygiene (GoHighLevel/Vintory) and market research. 



Who This Role Is For 



You may be a strong fit if you:  



Have STR Experience: You understand the fast-paced nature of property management. 

Are a Systems Thinker: You have built or improved SOPs and workflows before. 

Communicate Confidently: Exceptional spoken and written English; comfortable calling US vendors. 

Are Proactive: You think three steps ahead rather than waiting for instructions. 

Are AI-Fluency: You use AI tools beyond basic prompts to summarize data and draft systems. 

Have High Discernment: You know when a process doesn't make sense and needs to be updated. 



Preferred Qualifications 



Hands-on experience with Hospitable (Highly Preferred). 

Experience managing or scaling a portfolio of multiple properties. 

Familiarity with QuickBooks, CRM platforms, or OpenPhone. 

Spanish fluency is a plus (for vendor coordination). 



What Success Looks Like Within 90 days: 



Vendor coordination runs smoothly with minimal founder involvement. 

A centralized "SOP Library" is documented and being utilized. 

Operational tasks are tracked in a clear, transparent dashboard. 

The founder is focused on growth and partnerships, confident that the "machine" is running. 



Compensation & Schedule 



Hourly Rate: $7-12/hr (based on experience) 

Schedule: Wednesday- Monday, aligned with peak guest stays and opportunity to increase hours as the business scales 

Full-Time: 30-40 hrs/week 



To apply, kindly fill out this form:

title: Media Buyer for 8-figure brand - Availability during US and/or EU time zones required
description:
Media Buyer Purpose

The Media Buyer at BECH & YD ECOM manages day-to-day Meta ad operations and makes data-driven decisions that drive revenue for our Shopify brands. You handle significant ad spend with precision, reliability, and accountability. You interpret and report performance data so the team can make fast and informed decisions. You work with the Strategist and Creative Team to launch ads quickly, follow our media buying systems, and ensure monthly performance targets are achieved. You must be available during US and/or EU operating hours for communication, optimizations, and reporting.



Media Buyer Primary Roles

* Launch weekly dynamic creative tests

* Scale budgets based on KPIs and our Scaling Process

* Attend performance calls

* Complete weekly and monthly data reports

* Use attribution tools and strategist input

* Communicate daily in Slack

* Share data-based ideas and concepts



Qualifications and Character Traits

Direct experience required:

* Meta ads setup and launch for Shopify brands

* Managing ad accounts spending above $1,000 per day

* Tracking setup and troubleshooting

* Data analysis and reporting

* Working in a team environment



Character expectations:

* Extreme attention to detail

* Fast-moving and working in US/EU hours

* Organized and punctual

* Efficient while willing to refine work

* Strong data interpretation and communication

* Reliable and accountable

* Proactive communicator

* Coachable and growth-oriented



Compensation

* $5 per hour starting rate

* Performance-based bonuses

* 6 days per week



Growth Potential

* Strong performance results in increased responsibility and higher compensation



Application Requirement

* Submit a 2–3 minute Loom video introducing yourself

* Explain why you are a strong fit

* Share one example of managing and scaling a Meta ad account

* Applications without a Loom video will not be considered

title: Customer Support QA Analyst - Ecommerce
description:
Remote | Full-Time | Philippines Only

$750 - $900 USD/month



 

At most eCommerce brands, QA Analysts are treated like human checklists.



You’re expected to audit 100+ tickets per day.



And watch your recommendations vanish while the same mistakes repeat endlessly.



Here, it's different.



You'll focus on quality over quantity—auditing strategically instead of rushing through 100+ tickets a day.



And you won't just catch mistakes. You'll help prevent them.



You’ll dig deeper to understand why things break:

— Why did this customer feel unheard?

— Why did our rep send a template instead of showing empathy?

— Why does our knowledge base fail customers?



Then work with our CS Team Lead to solve it—shaping training, resources, and SOPs based on what you found.



Your ideas will actually matter here.



So if you're someone who:

— Prides themselves on catching details others miss

— Wants to have real impact on customer experience

— Thrives in fast-paced startups, not stagnant corporate environments

— Wants to do work that matters—improving the health and wellness of families



This opportunity is for you.





About Us

We're a wellness brand helping parents navigate their children's health. These are delicate topics where a careless
 can break trust, but an empathetic response can earn it completely.



Unlike most eCommerce brands that treat support as a cost center, we see it as the core of our mission. Every interaction is a chance to help a worried parent feel heard, reassured, and confident in their decision.



Right now, we're at a critical point. We're scaling fast—aiming for 8 figures in our second year—and we refuse to let quality slip as we grow.



That's why we need a QA Analyst who ensures every customer interaction meets our standard—no matter how quickly we scale.





The Role: What You'll Own

As our QA Analyst, you'll ensure every customer interaction reflects our mission of empathy, clarity, and safety.



You'll partner directly with our Customer Support Team Lead to maintain quality standards while we scale.



Your Core Responsibilities:



1. Audit Customer Interactions

— Review support tickets to evaluate quality standards

— Look beyond compliance: Did we actually help this customer?

— Spot patterns in what's working and what's breaking



2. Calibration & Standards

— Align with Team Lead on what "world-class" customer experience looks like

— Ensure audits are fair, consistent, and tied to actual customer outcomes



3. Deliver Actionable Insights

— Turn audit findings into clear, specific feedback for Team Lead

— Don't just point out problems—show exactly what needs to change

— Enable better coaching by providing data that actually helps

— Close the feedback loop: Did the coaching work? Did the SOP update solve the problem?



4. Identify Trends & Recommend Fixes

— Spot recurring customer pain points or Knowledge Base gaps

— Recommend SOP updates that prevent issues from repeating





What We're Looking For

We're not looking for a checkbox auditor who follows a script. 



We need a strategic thinker who can see the forest and the trees. [too metaphorical]



Must-Have Experience:

— 2+ years in Customer Support QA (eCommerce, wellness, or "high-empathy" industries preferred)

— Proficiency with helpdesk tools like Zendesk, Gorgias, or Help Scout

— Comfortable with project management tools like Notion, Asana, ClickUp, or Monday

— Exceptional written communication - you're auditing communication, so you need to be great at it

— You've improved QA processes before (not just followed someone else's playbook)



Must-Have Attributes:

— Fast Learner - Absorb product details, compliance guidelines, and brand voice quickly. Own —your workflow from day one.

— Self-Starter - Thrive in fast-paced environments. Navigate ambiguity with ease. Identify gaps and implement solutions without needing a step-by-step manual.

— Critical Thinker - Look beyond the surface to evaluate customer concerns objectively and ensure support remains world-class, empathetic, and mission-aligned.

— Detail-Obsessed - Notice the small things: a missed link, a typo, a tone that feels slightly off for a worried customer.

— Master of the Soft Skills - Understand the difference between "technically correct" and "actually helpful."





Compensation, Perks & Growth Path

Total Compensation: $750 - $900 USD/month

— Base Salary: $750/month

— Performance Bonus: Up to $150/month



Growth Path: Quality & Training Lead

— Design the full onboarding curriculum for our support team

— Build the global quality framework as we scale

— Train, manage, and develop a team of QA analysts



Professional Development

— Workshops, certifications, training - we'll support what you need to level up



Perks:

— Work with a mission-driven wellness brand making a real impact on families

— Small team = high visibility and meaningful influence

— Help build QA systems from the ground up at a fast-growing startup





Our Hiring Process:

1. Submit Application (linked below)

2. Loom Video Introduction

3. Technical Assessment

4. Interview with Customer Service Team Lead

5. Final Interview with our CEO

6. Reference Check





Our Core Values

Which one speaks to you most? Include it in your application.

MOVE FAST - Always prioritize quality, but do so with speed

WORLD CLASS - We expect excellence & reject mediocrity

GO ONE MORE - Win. Celebrate it. Then beat it.





We're building the #1 customer experience in the wellness space—and we need a QA Analyst who protects our standards and pushes them higher.



If you're ready to do work that actually matters with a team that cares as much as you do, hit apply.

title: Property Leasing Manager (LTR & PadSplit)
description:
Are you great at selling tenants on rentals, screening them fast, and closing deals all the way through lease signing and move-in?



Can you start adding value on day one, taking ownership of listings, leads, and conversions?



We’re a fast-growing property management group managing LTRs and PadSplit homes. We’re looking for someone smart, diligent, and proactive — someone who thrives on results, not supervision.



If you know how to:

- Market and lease properties quickly

- Prequalify and screen tenants effectively

- Coordinate move-ins and manage lead funnels

…then you’ll fit right in.





Long term, you’ll have the chance to build and lead your own leasing team as we scale.





Requirements:

- Strong leasing or property management experience (LTR or co-living preferred)

- Excellent spoken and written English (C2 level)

- High attention to detail, strong follow-through, and responsive communication

- Available to work U.S. EST/ET hours





If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and start making an impact immediately.





DO NOT APPLY IF:



Your English is not near-native or highly fluent (C2 level).

You do not have a strong leasing background.

You do not have a background in sales.

You are not tech-savvy.

You are not detail-oriented and highly diligent.

You need constant supervision or struggle to take ownership.





Application Process:

- Submit your resume and a short video introduction (via Google Drive or Loom — make sure the link is accessible). In your video, briefly introduce yourself and share why you’d be great for this role.

- Send us a message on OnlineJobs.ph explaining why you’re the right fit and what makes you stand out.

- Wait for our response — we carefully review every application and will contact shortlisted candidates for the next steps.



Thank you!

title: COO / Operations Manager: Run the Machine While We Scale to 7 Figures
description:
We don't need a task manager. We need someone who builds systems that prevent chaos before it starts.

If you're the type who:



Sees a bottleneck before it causes delays

Thinks "this needs a process" when you spot something being done manually

Can't stand when deadlines are missed because no one tracked them

Gets excited about turning chaos into predictable outcomes



...keep reading.



What we're building:

6-figure/month e-commerce operation across Europe (Switzerland FR/DE, Italy, US expansion launching). Multiple D2C stores, remote team across 4 timezones, aggressive scaling on TikTok and Meta Ads.

The problem: I (founder) am still buried in operations. Tracking deliverables, following up on blockers, coordinating the team, making sure nothing falls through the cracks. That has to change.

The solution: You.

You become the operational engine of this company. The person who makes sure every part of the machine moves when it should, without me having to check.



What you'll actually do:

Own operations end-to-end so the founder can focus on strategy and growth:

Daily Team Coordination:



Manage remote team: media buyer, 2 video editors, 2 copywriters, content researcher, finance manager, creative strategist

Track daily deliverables and make sure deadlines are hit

Follow up on blockers before they cause delays (not after)

Coordinate handoffs between tea
mbers: researcher ? copywriter ? video editor ? media buyer

Update project tracking systems daily (Notion, Google Sheets, Slack)

Flag issues before they escalate into fires



Slack & Communication Management:



Keep Slack organized: flag urgent items, kill noise, maintain clear channels

Ensure team debriefs are complete and actionable (no vague "working on it")

Escalate critical issues to founder immediately

Run daily standup or async check-ins to keep everyone aligned



Performance Tracking:



Set KPIs for each role (videos produced, campaigns launched, ROAS maintained, etc.)

Track team performance against KPIs weekly

Identify underperformers early and flag to founder

Conduct performance reviews and improvement plans



Financial & Admin Support:



Work with finance manager on: invoice tracking, payment follow-ups, receipt organization

Track ad spend vs budget by market (CH-FR, CH-DE, IT, US)

Help prepare weekly/monthly P&L summaries

Manage supplier payments and contracts



Hiring & HR:



Post job listings on Upwork/OnlineJobs when we need new roles

Screen applications: keyword filter ? DISC test ? typing test ? shortlist top 10

Schedule intro calls and follow-up interviews

Onboard new hires: tool access, SOP training, Loom walkthroughs, team intro in Slack



Process & Documentation:



Turn messy workflows into clean, repeatable SOPs

Record Loom videos when a process needs documentation

Update SOPs when things change (they will, constantly)

Organize Google Drive so anyone can find any file in under 10 seconds

Build systems that scale (what works at 30K/month should work at 100K/month)



Product Launch Management:



Ensure product testing pipeline flows smoothly: research ? creative ? campaign ? scale

Track testing: which products launched, which creatives went live, which campaigns are running

Make sure nothing gets stuck in limbo (product ready but no creatives, creatives ready but no campaign, etc.)



General "Make It Work" Tasks:



Handle operational fires that don't fit any category

Research tools, suppliers, agencies when needed

Be the person who says "I'll handle it" when something urgent comes up

Proactively spot inefficiencies and fix them





What makes you the right person:

? You're NOT someone who waits for instructions

? You see what needs to happen and make it happen

? You're NOT satisfied with "good enough"

? You want systems that actually work, not systems that just look organized

? You're NOT looking for a stable 9-5 doing the same thing forever

? You want to grow into a COO role as we scale to 7 figures

? You're NOT afraid of chaos

? You see chaos as an opportunity to build systems

? You're NOT passive

? You hold people accountable and push when deadlines slip



You should apply if:



Proven operations experience: You've managed operations, projects, or teams in fast-moving environments (e-commerce, startups, agencies, remote teams)

Team management skills: You've coordinated 5+ people before and kept them on track

Systems thinker: You're obsessed with organization, process, and follow-through

Great juggler: You can manage 10 priorities without dropping any

Clear communicator: Fluent English (written + verbal) — this is non-negotiable

Tool proficient: Google Workspace, Slack, Notion (or similar project tools), and you learn new tools fast

Independent: You don't need hand-holding — you figure things out

Timezone flexible: Comfortable working across timezones with a global team

Available 30-40 hours/week



Bonus points if you have:



Experience in e-commerce operations specifically

Hired, onboarded, or trained people before

Built SOPs and process documentation from scratch

Managed P&L tracking or financial reporting

Experience with European markets (time zones, business culture)





What you get:



$7-$10/hour to start, negotiable based on experience (we pay more as you prove yourself)

Performance bonuses: Hit operational KPIs ? systems run smoothly ? you earn more

Clear path to COO: Prove yourself for 3-6 months ? become true Chief Operating Officer with equity potential

Direct access to founder: You'll see how decisions are made, shape strategy, not just execute orders

Autonomy to build systems: If it works, we keep it; if it doesn't, we iterate — you have freedom to build

Long-term role with equity potential: As operations become critical to scaling, there's room for ownership stake





This role is NOT for everyone.

If you want predictable tasks, a quiet job, and zero responsibility — don't apply.

If you want to be the person who builds the infrastructure that turns a 6-figure business into a 7-figure machine — keep reading.



How to apply:



First sentence MUST include "OPS" or your application gets deleted immediately (this filters people who don't read)

Describe a time you fixed something broken in a company/team without being asked — what was the problem, what did you do, what was the result?

List every tool you've used for operations/project management (Notion, Asana, ClickUp, Monday, Slack workflows, Google Sheets, etc.)

Tell us your experience coordinating remote teams or working across timezones

What's your approach to holding tea
mbers accountable when they miss deadlines?

Hours available per week + your timezone



No generic cover letters. No ChatGPT responses. Show us you understand operations, not just task completion.



Hiring process:



Top 10 candidates ? DISC personality test + typing test

10-minute intro call ? we check: are you sharp? can you communicate clearly? do you ask intelligent questions?

Test task ? fix a messy workflow and document it in a simple SOP (we'll give you a real scenario)

Follow-up call ? deeper operational questions about team management, systems, problem-solving

Hire decision within 3 days



Start date: ASAP

title: Technical Recruiter (Eastern Time)
description:
Uptime Crew is a hire-train-deploy organization that partners with leading global tech companies to identify, assess, and develop top emerging software talent. We remove barriers to opportunity by running rigorous training programs that prepare candidates for real enterprise roles.



We are currently seeking a Technical Recruiter who will focus primarily on conducting professional, structured technical screens for candidates who have already passed our coding challenge. This role requires someone who is highly reliable, detail-oriented, and comfortable assessing technical communication, problem-solving, and engineering fundamentals.



This role requires the ability to work full-time in Eastern Time (ET). Reliable, high-speed internet access suitable for video interviews is mandatory.



Key Responsibilities



Technical Screening

- Conduct 30-minute structured technical screens with candidates who have passed our coding challenge.

- Evaluate candidates’ technical reasoning, communication, decision-making, and understanding of fundamental programming concepts.

- Complete detailed forms with clear, timely, and objective notes.

- Maintain strict professionalism, consistency, and punctuality across all screens.



Recruiting Operations

- Collaborate with the Uptime Crew recruiting team to manage candidate flow from coding challenge ? technical screen ? next steps.

- Provide timely updates and communication to ensure a smooth candidate experience.

- Surface patterns, risks, or concerns in candidate quality or process efficiency.



Pipeline Management

- Maintain accurate candidate records in our Applicant Tracking System (ATS).

- Ensure same-day submission of scorecards and follow-up documentation.

- Support the team in building a reliable, predictable pipeline of qualified technical candidates.



About You



You are someone who shows up on time, takes ownership of the candidate experience, and maintains high standards of professionalism. You’re comfortable asking technical questions, digging into a candidate’s reasoning, and identifying strong engineering fundamentals. You value consistency, fairness, and accuracy in your evaluations.

title: Senior Bookkeeper
description:
Company Overview: 



BE SmartAdmin Services Pty Ltd (BESAS) is a bespoke Australian startup providing tailored administrative, paraplanning, and bookkeeping solutions for clients across financial planning, property, creative design, and mortgage lending. We deliver high-quality, customized support that helps our clients streamline operations and achieve their goals. 



At BESAS, we value honesty, innovation, and collaboration, and we balance excellence with well-being—creating a positive, supportive environment where every idea matters. 



We’re looking for individuals with a “can-do” attitude who thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup. This is your chance to take ownership, grow professionally, and make a meaningful impact on both our clients and the company’s journey. If you’re proactive, motivated, and ready to push your career forward, BESAS is the place to do it. 



Role Overview 



We’re looking for an experienced Senior Bookkeeper with strong proficiency in Xero (and MYOB) to manage their own client portfolio while contributing to the growth and efficiency of our bookkeeping team. This role reports directly to the Operations Head and offers career progression opportunities as the team and client base expand. It’s perfect for someone ready to take on responsibility, mentor colleagues, and contribute to shaping best practices in a dynamic, remote team.   



Key Responsibilities 



Team Support & Leadership – Team Enablement Role 



   -  Provide support to the bookkeeping team and help ensure smooth daily operations. 

   -  Assist with assigning client files based on skills, experience, and workload to optimize efficiency. 

   -  Maintain high quality and consistency across all deliverables. 

   -  Offer guidance, mentorship, and knowledge sharing to tea
mbers. 

   -  Contribute to refining workflows and documenting standard operating procedures. 

   -  Monitor team productivity and ensure accurate time-tracking via Clockify. 

   -  Support in addressing client inquiries or concerns that require additional attention. 



Client-Facing Bookkeeping Tasks 



   -  Weekly: Process and code transactions in Xero and MYOB; reconcile bank feeds, corporate cards, and supplier invoices; update client file statuses and communicate progress. 

   -  Fortnightly: Process payroll (STP-compliant); reconcile PAYG and superannuation; lodge timesheets if applicable. 

   -  Monthly: Finalize reconciliations for bank accounts, credit cards, and loans; generate and review management reports (P&L, Balance Sheet, etc.); prepare BAS-ready reports; monitor cash flow and unpaid invoices. 

   -  Quarterly & Annually: Prepare/review BAS, FBT, GST, and payroll compliance; generate quarterly client performance summaries; support client accountants with year-end working papers and EOFY payroll reports; archive completed files and ensure documentation compliance. 



Qualifications & Experience 



   -  Minimum 5 years hands-on bookkeeping experience, preferably with Australian clients. 

   -  At least 1 year experience supervising or mentoring tea
mbers is a plus. 

   -  Strong technical proficiency in Xero (Xero Payroll, Xero Practice Manager) and MYOB (AccountRight or Essentials). 

   -  Knowledge of Australian GST, BAS, payroll, and compliance requirements. 

   -  Comfortable in client-facing interactions via calls,
s, and Zoom. 



Professional Attributes 



   -  Proactive, solutions-oriented, and enthusiastic about learning and growth. 

   -  Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects under deadlines.

title: Remote Joinery Estimator (EN Standards)
description:
Connaught Joinery – Ireland

Full-Time | Remote (Philippines) | Long-Term Position



Connaught Joinery is an Irish manufacturing company specialising in premium prehung doorsets, fire doors, and bespoke joinery.

We are seeking an experienced Joinery Estimator to prepare detailed tenders, quotations, and schedules of works for our Irish and European projects - fully remotely from the Philippines.



-



Role Overview



You will be responsible for preparing accurate cost estimates and schedules for joinery and doorset projects.

This includes interpreting architectural drawings, door schedules, and ironmongery specifications, ensuring all outputs meet European (EN) standards for fire and acoustic performance.



You’ll work closely with our Irish estimating and production teams to deliver precise, compliant, and professional tenders.



-



Key Responsibilities

 • Review architectural drawings, door schedules, and specifications

 • Prepare tender quotations, BOQs, and Schedules of Works

 • Apply and understand EN fire door standards (FD30, FD60, etc.)

 • Compile ironmongery sets and confirm compliance with EN-rated hardware

 • Support pricing through templates or exports from Intact IQ ERP

 • Collaborate via Microsoft Teams and shared folders with our Irish team

 • Maintain consistency, accuracy, and attention to detail in all outputs



-



Required Skills & Experience

 • Minimum 3 years’ experience in joinery, fit-out, or doorset estimating

 • Strong knowledge of:

 • EN-standard fire doors and acoustic doorsets

 • Ironmongery schedules and hardware coordination

 • Prehung and bespoke joinery systems

 • Proficient in Excel, PDF markup, and AutoCAD or Bluebeam for take-offs

 • Excellent English communication and strong technical understanding

 • Highly organised, self-motivated, and able to meet tender deadlines



-



Preferred (Not Required)

 • Familiarity with Intact IQ ERP or similar systems

 • Experience with PlanSwift, Bluebeam, or take-off software

 • Prior exposure to Irish or European joinery standards



-



Compensation & Benefits

 • p46,000 – p70,000 per month (USD $800 – $1,200 equivalent)

 • Performance bonus based on project accuracy and turnaround

 • Long-term contract with career growth opportunities

 • Monday–Friday, 4 PM – 12 AM PH time (to align with Ireland)

 • Fully remote with video check-ins and digital workflow



-



About Connaught Joinery



Connaught Joinery is part of The Connaught Door Centre Group, based in Galway, Ireland.

We design and manufacture premium prehung door systems, EN fire doors, and bespoke joinery for residential and commercial projects nationwide.

Our operations are built on precision CNC manufacturing, ERP-driven workflows, and a culture of excellence.



-



How to Apply



Please submit:

 1. Your CV / résumé

 2. An example of a tender, take-off, or quotation you’ve produced

 3. A short note on your experience with EN-standard fire doors or joinery projects



Please send the above to :

description:

We are a fast growing UK based short term let and serviced accommodation business managing multiple properties and entities. We are looking for a detail driven Bookkeeping and Accounting VA with strong hands on expertise in QuickBooks Online.



This role is suited to someone who enjoys accuracy, structure and improving financial systems. It is not an entry level role. You will be trusted with clean records across multiple entities.



This role will start part time at 25 hours per week at $4 per hour as a trial period, with the intention to move to full time hours and a higher rate once the right long term candidate is proven.



Some overlap with UK working hours is required.

This role suits someone looking for a focused long term position rather than juggling multiple ongoing roles.



Key responsibilities



Bookkeeping and accounting

Full bookkeeping in QuickBooks Online

Accurate categorisation of all transactions

Bank and credit card reconciliations

Handling multiple entities and accounts

Understanding income splits between client income and management income

Monthly profit and loss preparation

Cashflow tracking and visibility

Preparing clean records for VAT returns and year end accounts

Working with Airbnb, 
 and direct booking payouts

Creating systems and improving bookkeeping workflows

Using ChatGPT to improve efficiency, accuracy and consistency where appropriate



Required skills and experience

Expert level working knowledge of QuickBooks Online

At least 1 year hands on bookkeeping or accounting experience

Strong understanding of bookkeeping fundamentals

High attention to detail and accuracy

Fluent English spoken and written

Excellent organisation and time management

Confident using ChatGPT as a daily work tool

Able to follow instructions exactly and consistently

Reliable internet connection and quiet working environment

Willing to learn the short term let industry if not already experienced



Nice to have

Not holding multiple full time roles or conflicting long term commitments, allowing full focus and high performance

Experience with Airbnb or short term lets

Understanding of VAT or multi entity businesses

Experience creating SOPs and improving workflows



What success looks like after 90 days

Books are fully up to date and accurate

title: TikTok Ads Media Buyer: Scale E-Commerce Brands to 6-7 Figures
description:
We need a media buyer who's already done this before.

If you:



Have scaled e-commerce brands past $100K/month on TikTok Ads

Know the difference between testing strategy and scaling strategy

Can read data and make decisions fast (not wait for permission)

Understand creative fatigue and how to refresh before performance dies

Don't need hand-holding to set up pixels, campaigns, or troubleshoot account issues



...keep reading.



What we're building:

We run a 6-figure/month e-commerce operation across Switzerland (FR/DE), Italy, and expanding to the US. Multiple D2C stores, 8+ active products, aggressive testing and scaling on TikTok Ads and Meta.

We need someone who owns the paid acquisition engine — testing, scaling, and keeping ROAS stable while we grow.



Your actual job:

Run TikTok Ads profitably at scale:

Campaign Management:



Launch 3-5 new product tests per day with SmartPlus campaigns

Manage budget allocation across markets (CH-FR, CH-DE, IT, US)

Scale winners aggressively without killing ROAS

Kill losers fast (no emotional attachment to products)

Monitor daily performance and adjust budgets in real-time



Creative Testing:



Test 3+ creatives per product minimum

Identify winning hooks, angles, and formats

Request new creatives from video editors when creative fatigue hits

Test trending TikTok sounds and formats (using TikTok Creative Center)

Add static images to scaling campaigns when applicable



Data & Optimization:



Track ROAS by product, market, and creative

Identify which products to scale vs kill based on data (not gut feeling)

Optimize ad spend to hit profit targets (we track net margin, not just ROAS)

Report daily: what's working, what's not, what needs changing

Use tools: TikTok Ads Manager, TrueProfit, Google Sheets for tracking



Technical Setup:



Set up pixels, Business Centers, and ad accounts independently

Troubleshoot tracking issues (pixel fires, attribution problems)

Handle DMCA or account flags without panic

Manage multiple ad accounts across different markets





What makes you the right person:

? You're NOT a beginner who "wants to learn TikTok Ads"

? You've already scaled brands to $50K-$100K/month+ on TikTok

? You're NOT someone who needs step-by-step instructions

? You know how to test, read data, and scale without micromanagement

? You're NOT just a "campaign launcher"

? You understand the entire funnel: creative ? campaign ? conversion ? profit

? You're NOT afraid of high ad spend

? You're comfortable managing $3K-$10K+ daily budgets



You should apply if:



Proven track record: You've scaled e-commerce brands on TikTok Ads (fashion, beauty, lifestyle, home goods — any category works)

Data-driven: You make decisions based on numbers, not feelings

Creative-minded: You understand what makes a TikTok ad work (hooks, trends, formats)

Fast executor: You test fast, kill fast, scale fast

Technical: Pixel setup, Business Center management, tracking troubleshooting — you've done it all

Independent: You don't wait for approval to make obvious optimizations

English fluent: Clear written and verbal communication (we're a global team)

Available 30-40 hours/week



Bonus points if you have:



Experience with European markets (Germany, Switzerland, Italy)

Experience scaling SmartPlus campaigns specifically

Knowledge of Meta Ads (we run both platforms)

Experience with multi-market campaigns (different languages, currencies)





What you get:



$8-$12/hour to start, negotiable based on results (we pay more as you scale profitably)

Performance bonuses: Hit ROAS targets consistently ? earn more

Clear growth path: Prove yourself ? become Head of Paid Acquisition

Direct access to founder: You'll shape strategy, not just execute

Budget to work with: We're ready to spend — you just need to make it profitable

Long-term role: We're building for 7 figures, not a quick project





This isn't for everyone.

If you want a "safe" job where you launch campaigns and wait for results — don't apply.

If you want to own paid acquisition for a fast-scaling brand and get rewarded for performance — keep reading.



How to apply:



First sentence MUST include "SCALE" or we delete your application

Share your best TikTok Ads case study (product, budget, ROAS, revenue — real numbers only)

Tell us which markets/countries you've worked in

List the e-commerce brands or niches you've scaled (fashion, beauty, home, etc.)

What's your testing strategy for new products? (Describe your process in 3-4 sentences)

Hours available per week + timezone



No generic applications. No made-up numbers. Show us proof.



Hiring process:



Top 10 candidates ? DISC test + typing test

10-minute intro call ? check: do you know your shit? can you communicate clearly?

Test task ? Launch a test campaign with provided creatives and report results

Follow-up call ? deeper strategy questions, ROAS targets, scaling approach

Hire within 3 days



Start date: ASAP

We're ready to spend. Are you ready to scale?

title: Home Health EMR/EHR Wellsky Specialist
description:
WellSky Home Health EMR/EHR Software Specialist (Remote)

Compensation: $7 USD per hour

Experience Required, This is not an entry-level role.

??Applicants MUST be highly proficient in WellSky Home Health (Kinnser) and must provide proof of completed WellSky training and certification.



??INSTRUCTIONS TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY):

Submit your updated resume.

Send a 30-second introduction video describing your experience using WellSky Home Health.

Provide three (3) professional references from former supervisors or managers.

Attach copies of your official WellSky training completion certificates.



ABOUT US:

Amity Health Group is a fast-growing home health organization focused on excellence, compliance, and efficient operations. We rely heavily on accurate and consistent use of WellSky Home Health for our skilled services across multiple states.

We are seeking a WellSky Home Health Software Specialist who will oversee software usage, ensure system accuracy, and educate our team to maintain consistent and compliant workflows.



POSITION SUMMARY:

This per-diem role is responsible for mastering, navigating, and managing all aspects of the WellSky Home Health software and ensuring our team understands and correctly uses the system.

The specialist will train staff, audit workflows, guide system usage, and ensure our processes align with skilled home health guidelines, including services such as PT, OT, Nursing, Wound Care, and Speech Therapy.

Applicants must already be fully trained in WellSky and able to provide certification proof.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

System Navigation & Software Expertise

Navigate all modules of WellSky Home Health with expert proficiency.

Guide staff on documentation, visit entry, workflows, care planning, scheduling, and episode management.

Ensure correct use of the platform for skilled home health services.

Team Education & Training

Train new and existing staff on how to use WellSky effectively.

Create and lead training sessions, onboarding guides, and workflow instructions.

Provide ongoing support for clinicians, intake, scheduling, QA, and administrative teams.

Ensure every tea
mber understands system expectations and can confidently use the software.

Workflow & Compliance Oversight

Audit documentation workflows to ensure compliance with home health guidelines and agency standards.

Ensure workflows follow proper sequencing for skilled services (PT, OT, Nursing, Wound Care, SLP).

Identify documentation or workflow gaps and provide corrective guidance.

Assist with system updates, configuration checks, and process improvements.

Support & Problem Resolution

Provide troubleshooting support for software-related issues.

Serve as the internal “go-to expert” for all WellSky questions.

Collaborate with leadership to maintain consistent and compliant system usage.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Official WellSky Home Health training completion (certificates required).

Extensive experience using WellSky Home Health in a skilled home health environment.

Familiarity with home health operations, workflows, and clinical documentation outlines.

Strong teaching, training, and communication skills.

Ability to work independently and support a multi-state team remotely.

Highly organized, patient, and detail-oriented.



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Experience training or supporting home health teams in a similar role.

Background in skilled home health operations or QA.

Experience improving workflow efficiency through system guidance.



CORE EXPECTATIONS:

Software mastery

Strong educator and communicator

Patience and clarity in training

Attention to workflow compliance

Organizational excellence

Proactive problem-solving

Independence and accountability

Sekha

title: Preconstruction & Technical Support Architect (Remote – Construction Focus)
description:
About Us



North Texas Masonry Builders, LLC is a U.S.-based commercial masonry contractor specializing in CMU, brick, stone, flashing, and air/water barrier systems. We bid multiple commercial projects daily and are expanding our preconstruction operations.



We are seeking an architectural professional based in the Philippines to support our estimating and preconstruction department. This is a long-term remote opportunity with growth potential.



Role Overview:



This role supports preconstruction, estimating coordination, submittals, and shop drawing preparation. The ideal candidate can read and interpret U.S. construction documents and is comfortable working in a fast-paced bid environment.



Key Responsibilities:

-Preconstruction & Bid Support

-Review architectural and structural plans

-Identify and outline masonry scope within drawings and specs

-Extract relevant specification sections

-Assist estimators with scope breakdown

-Organize project folders and documentation

-Track addenda and revisions

-Maintain bid logs and project tracking sheets

-Submittals

-Prepare and organize masonry material submittals

-Compile product data and cut sheets

-Maintain submittal logs

-Track approval status and revisions

-Coordinate corrections based on architect comments

-Shop Drawings & RFIs

-Assist in preparation of masonry shop drawings (if CAD capable)

-Mark up drawings per internal direction

-Draft RFIs clearly and professionally

-Track and manage revisions



Required Qualifications:

-Degree in Architecture or related field

-Strong ability to read and interpret construction drawings and specifications

-Experience with U.S.-based construction documents preferred

-Familiarity with CSI MasterFormat

-Strong written English communication skills

-Detail-oriented and organized

-Technical Skills Preferred

-AutoCAD and/or Revit

-Bluebeam or PDF markup tools

-Microsoft Outlook and Excel

-Experience preparing contractor submittals



Minimum Computer Requirements:

-Windows Operating System

-Intel i7 Processor (or equivalent)

-Minimum 8 GB RAM (16 GB preferred)

-NVIDIA Graphics Card (Minimum 4 GB)

-1920 x 1080 screen resolution

-Stable high-speed internet connection



Ideal Candidate:

-Comfortable in a high-volume bid environment

-Able to manage multiple deadlines

-Strong document control skills

-Interested in long-term growth within a construction company

-Proactive and able to work independently

-Work Schedule

-Must overlap with U.S. Central Time (CST) working hours

-Full-time remote position



Compensation:

Competitive salary based on experience and skill level.



To Apply Please submit the following:



-Resume

-Portfolio (if available)

-Description of experience with submittals and shop drawings

-List of software proficiency

-Expected Hourly salary in USD

-A 2–3 minute introduction video answering the following:

-Brief overview of your architectural/structural experience

-Experience working with U.S. construction documents

-Experience preparing submittals or shop drawings

-Why you are interested in working in a contractor-focused environment



Screening Questions:



Have you worked on U.S.-based construction documents?



Have you prepared contractor submittals before?



Are you comfortable working in a high-volume bid environment?



What CAD software are you proficient in?



What is your expected hourly rate in USD?

title: WordPress Web Developer & SEO Specialist – Remote
description:
WordPress Web Developer & SEO Specialist – Remote

About Us

We are a growing digital agency based in Europe specializing in web development, SEO, and AI-powered content. We build and deliver complete web projects for clients across multiple industries and markets.



What You'll Be Doing



Building WordPress websites from scratch to client delivery

Designing and building in Elementor

Managing technical and on-page SEO for client projects

Writing and editing English content – AI tools are welcome, but final output must be clean and client-ready

Custom WordPress coding when needed (PHP, CSS, custom hooks)

Owning the full project lifecycle – you take it from brief to satisfied client handover





What We're Looking For



Strong hands-on experience with WordPress and Elementor

Solid technical SEO knowledge – site speed, Core Web Vitals, schema, crawlability

Proven on-page SEO skills – keyword research, meta tags, content structure, internal linking

Basic off-page SEO knowledge – link building, citations, outreach

Ability to write and edit English copy to a professional standard

Custom WordPress coding skills beyond Elementor

Reliable, self-managed, and results-driven – we don't micromanage





Nice to Have



Experience with WooCommerce

Google Search Console and Analytics

Page speed optimization (caching, image compression, CDN)

Local SEO experience





How We Pay

We believe in rewarding results, not just time. Your base compensation is tied to hours worked, but we regularly reward on top of that – bonuses for successful project delivery, satisfied client handovers, and measurable SEO outcomes. The better you perform, the more you earn. We value long-term relationships and always recognize people who consistently deliver.



Why Work With Us



Long-term, stable position with a growing agency

Fully remote and flexible hours

Work on real projects for real clients across Europe and beyond

Room to grow as we scale – we promote from within

Work with modern tools and a team that moves fast





How to Apply

Send us a short message about yourself and your experience. Include links to websites you've built or managed. A strong portfolio matters more than a perfect resume.

title: UGC Outreach VA – Cooking App
description:
We're a newly launched cooking app looking for a talented and driven Virtual Assistant to join our growing team. This is a ground-floor opportunity. You'll be one of our first hires, meaning real ownership of your work and a direct line to growth as the app scales.





What You'll Be Doing

You’ll primarily focus on UGC outreach and creator relationship management, helping us build and maintain strong partnerships with content creators and food influencers. Your main responsibility will be identifying suitable UGC creators, sending outreach messages, following up consistently, tracking responses, and managing ongoing communication to ensure smooth collaborations.



You’ll also assist in coordinating deliverables — confirming briefs, deadlines, usage rights, and content submissions — while keeping our outreach pipeline organized and up to date.



This role is ideal for someone who is highly organized, proactive in communication, detail-oriented, and comfortable building relationships online.



What We're Looking For

Strong written and spoken English is a must - you'll be communicating directly with creators on our behalf, so clarity and professionalism matter.  A passion or background in food and cooking is a big plus. This app is all about helping people cook better, so enthusiasm for the niche will come through in your work.





The Details



- Part-time: 20 hours per week

- Compensation: ?20,000/month

- Fully remote, flexible hours

- High likelihood of transitioning to full-time as the app grows, plus bonuses and pay increases to match





Why Join Us

We just launched, which means you won't be one of a hundred employees. You'll be a key part of building something from the ground up. The people who come in early will have the most to gain as the app grows.

If you love food content, know how to make videos that hook people in the first three seconds, and are organised enough to manage creator outreach without things falling through the cracks, we'd love to hear from you.



To apply, please use your name and the word “FOOD” in the subject line of your application and share your experience in UGC research and outreach including the your step-by-step process for finding and evaluating UGC creators.



We’re looking for someone who already understands how to source quality UGC and build scalable outreach systems.
